resources.string: Maybe you tell me 'bout resting and stuff again?
Got it. Go on.
Whoa, could you back up and repeat that, please?
You go too fast. You go back and say again, please?
Simple. Go on.
You lost me there. Can you repeat that, please?
Whoa - me no follow. You say again, 'kay?
Okay. What else?
Sorry, but could you go over that one more time?
Me sorry, but mabye you be say that again, 'kay?
I don't need a final tutorial. I'm ready for the Mage's Challenge now.
Me not need final tutorial - me want do Mage Challenge now.
Ready.
Forget about me - go protect the Waterdhavian creatures!
Come speak to me.

Hey there, <FullName>, welcome to my little corner of the Academy. I'm Jaroo, resident Master of the Arcane. It's more a ceremonial title than anything else. I'm really just your run-of-the-mill wizard.
No doubt you have come here to complete your training. Well, you've come to the right place. Nobody at this institution knows more about teaching you apprentices magic than me.
Look, <FirstName>, I'm not trying to be rude, but are you sure you're in the right place? My expertise is in mage and sorcerer spells, and you can't cast either type.
If you want, I guess I can give you a lesson in casting spells, but it won't bring you any closer to completing your training at the Academy. Or do you need something else?
Ah, <FirstName>, I didn't expect you to come back. What can I do for you?
Well, <FirstName>, have you decided to take the Mage's Challenge? It's the final step in your training here at the Academy, after all.
Good luck to you, <FirstName>. I don't know what your future holds, but I sense you are destined for great things.
Your training is done, <FirstName>. You should go to the south assembly hall to receive a blessing and congratulations from Lady Aribeth.
Since you're a wizard, I'll start by showing you how to prepare spells.
Since you're not a wizard you don't need to learn how to prepare spells. If you want I can still show you how it's done, but you won't need to learn it.
To prepare a spell, you have to access your spellbooks. Don't do this now or you'll break out of dialog and have to start over. Just listen to my instructions and you can try it later.
This will bring up your spellbook menu. On the left side you will see all the spells in your spellbook. On the right side, you will see the spells you currently have prepared.
Click and drag the spells you want to prepare from your spellbook over to your prepared spells page. Don't forget that you'll have to rest before the spells are prepared.
Okay, I guess we can move right on to the lessons about resting.

It's very important for a spellcaster to remember to rest. Resting is how you replenish your spells. To rest, simply click the Rest icon below your character portrait. It's the one that looks like a closed eyelash.
Okay, I guess we'll start with the basics. Bards and sorcerers don't have to prepare spells to cast them, but wizards can only cast spells they've prepared beforehand.
Whenever you rest, your spells will replenish themselves. Lower level spells replenish first and more quickly; higher level spells take longer.
If you have the spells loaded into your quickbar, you'll see their icons highlight as they get refreshed. Remember to rest often, but don't forget that you can't rest while in combat.

During your adventures, you will find scrolls with spells you haven't learned. Wizards can scribe new spells from scrolls into their spellbooks, but sorcerers and bards can only learn new spells when they increase in level.

To add a new spell to your spellbook, simply open your inventory and spellbook at the same time. Then, drag the scroll from your inventory to your spellbook. Remember that scribing a spell from a scroll like this will destroy the scroll.
That's it. The basics of spell casting in a nutshell. So, <FirstName>, you ready to face the Mage's Challenge? It's the last step in completing your arcane training here at the Academy.
That's all I can teach you about casting spells, <FirstName>, though I don't see what use the knowledge of arcane magic will be to you. Is there something else I can do for you?
The test is a simple one, <FirstName>. See the statue in the center of the room? All you have to do is destroy it using a spell and the challenge will be complete.

To help you in this task, there are two scrolls in the chest against the north wall. You can scribe these scrolls to your spellbook or right-click on the scrolls and select the Use Item icon from the menu to cast the spell right from the scroll.
The best way to actually cast your spells is by using the quickbar. Remember: you have two extra quickbars that can be accessed using the "SHIFT" and "CTRL" keys.
To load a spell onto your quickbar, simply open your spellbook, then click and drag the spell to the desired slot on one of your quickbars. The spell can now be cast with a single keystroke.
Non-targeted spells will cast automatically after you select them using the quickbar, but many spells require a target, be it a creature, an object or even a spot on the ground.
After selecting a targeting spell using the quickbar, your cursor will change to display the spell icon. To then cast the spell, simply left-click with your cursor on the target.
Come speak to me when you finish the test. I'll be waiting right here.
Is something wrong, <FirstName>? I see you haven't finished the Mage's Challenge. Do you need me to go over it one more time?
Okay, I'll do my best. Fire away.
One thing I can tell you is not to believe unfounded rumors. Those who claim the plague was caused intentionally by some unknown enemy of Neverwinter are only adding to the panic.
Nobody knows where the Wailing Death came from, just as nobody knows how to stop it from spreading. And until now there hasn't been any prayer or potion that can cure it.
But I think Lady Aribeth is headed in the right direction now. She's a smart one, and I think Lord Nasher made the right choice putting her in charge of dealing with this plague.

I shouldn't say anything, but I suppose the information is common knowledge among the students by now. Khelben Arunsun, the most famous mage this side of Elminster himself, discovered a cure for the Wailing Death.
Waterdeep helped us out by capturing the monsters necessary to concoct the cure and they sent them here to the Academy for safekeeping. That's the real reason Lady Aribeth is here, I suspect.

Well, I've never actually met her myself. I know she's an Elven paladin in the service of Tyr, and I know she's the one in charge of keeping order in Neverwinter and finding a cure for the Wailing Death.

And, of course, everybody knows she's here giving blessings to those who have finished their Academy training. Students have been piling into the south assembly hall since early this morning just to meet her.
Leave it to a mage to come up with a cure when all the priests and healers couldn't, right? Old Blackstaff figured out that combining the proper reagents would make an elixir to save us all.
Sure, we don't want you to miss out on this. It's important stuff.
Consider this a final tutorial on casting spells before you face the Mage's Challenge. Are you ready to begin?
Really? Well - if you're ready then I guess we can begin.
Congratulations, you have shown great control of your magical abilities. Speak to me before you leave.
To bring up your spellbook menu, press the "B" key or left-click on the SPELLBOOK button below your character portrait.
Sorry, I didn't mean to interrupt.
Me sorry. Me not mean to interrupt.
I think I'll be going now.
What's your problem? I'm just trying to be friendly.
Me go now.
Why you so mad? Me just want be talk at you.
Why do you want to meet Lady Aribeth?
How's your training going?
I want to ask you a few questions.
Why you want meet Aribeth?
How you training going?
Me want ask you some questions.
What can you tell me about the plague?
Have you heard those rumors about a cure for the plague?
How do you like training here at the Academy?
What you know 'bout plague?
You hear stuff 'bout cure for plague?
You like training at Academy?
I won't take much of your time. I promise.
Me speak at you quick. Me promise me not use much time.
You better answer my questions if you know what's good for you!
You answer me question or you be sorry!
Why are you so sure the plague is magical in nature?
Why you think plague be magic?
Can you not see I am in the middle of training? You are a <class>. You should appreciate how difficult the translation of the arcane texts can be. So why are you bothering me?
Can't you see that I'm in the middle of training? The Academy might go easy on a <class> like you, but those of us wishing to master the arcane cannot afford to waste our days chatting.
You again? Can you not see I am in the middle of my training? What is it you want this time?
This spell demands my full attention and I cannot afford these constant interruptions!
(Sigh) Master Jaroo often warns me about the perils of prolonged casting. Perhaps a short break would be good for me. Perhaps it will even give me a chance to meet Lady Aribeth.
Then I shall resume my perusal of these rather obscure and difficult texts.
Very well. Perhaps if I answer your questions you will stop pestering me.
She is a powerful and influential figure within the city. Lady Aribeth has been given the task of finding a cure for the plague by Lord Nasher himself.
Lady Aribeth could be a valuable ally in the future. I would be foolish to throw away a chance to meet someone who could be so valuable to my career.
I see no point in false modesty, I find the core materials to be somewhat beneath my abilities. Fortunately, Jaroo has supplemented my studies with a number of more advanced tomes and parchments.
He appreciates my potential, though he constantly harps on me about the dangers of delving too deeply into the arcane. Perhaps he fears I will be devoured by my hunger for knowledge.
Still, I suppose it would be wise to heed his cautions. Perhaps I will meet with Lady Aribeth later this evening instead of studying all night, as is my usual practice.
An interesting topic, one I have studied in great detail. From a safe distance, of course.
Can you comprehend the fearsome power and terrible resolve of one who could have unleashed the Wailing Death on our city? It boggles the mind, doesn't it?
Of course. Khelben Arunsun, a mage of inestimable power, has devised a cure that can be extracted from components gathered from creatures both rare and magical.
I am no expert, but the evidence as I see it offers only one logical explanation: the source of this pestilence is magical rather than natural.
Protect the Waterdhavian creatures!
Are you threatening me? I should report you and have you expelled from the Academy! But I have not the time; I must get back to my study of these ancient tomes. Leave me be.
The evidence is obvious, is it not? Neverwinter is the only city afflicted by the Wailing Death, and the disease resists all attempts by the clergy to find a cure.
I do not know who would do such a thing, but it would require a wizard of great power. A lich, perhaps. Or possibly even the Arcane Brotherhood of Luskan. But these are just guesses.
The rumors also say the creatures have been brought here to the Academy. No doubt that is why Lady Aribeth now graces us with her presence. Perhaps I will find an opportunity to meet her later.
Sorry, I didn't mean to interrupt.
Me sorry. Me not mean to interrupt.
I think I'll be going now.
What's your problem? I'm just trying to be friendly.
Me go now.
Why you so mad? Me just want be talk at you.
What do you have against Lady Aribeth?
How's your training going?
I want to ask you a few questions.
Why you not like Aribeth?
How you training going?
Me want ask you some questions.
What can you tell me about the plague?
What can you tell me about those rumors of a cure for the plague?
How do you like training here at the Academy?
What you know 'bout plague?
You hear stuff 'bout cure for plague?
You like training at Academy?
I won't take much of your time. I promise.
Me speak at you quick. Me promise me not use much time.
You better answer my questions if you know what's good for you!
You answer me question or you be sorry!
Can you blame people for losing faith? After all, you can't help them.
Why you mad people lose faith? You not help them anyway.
I have no time to talk with you - I am very busy preparing the sacred devotional rituals. You are a <class>, I am sure you understand.
I have no time to talk. The Academy might go easy on a <class> like you, but we who serve the divine will have many tasks and duties we must perform.
I see you have returned. Is there something else you need?
Forgive me. I did not mean to be so harsh, but I am very busy. Elynwyd, my mentor in the divine arts, has ordered me to make preparations for us to honor Lady Aribeth's arrival.
I suppose I can spare a few minutes for you. My heart is not in the preparations to honor Lady Aribeth, anyway. A waste of time, in my opinion.
Then I shall return to the duties Elynwyd has assigned me. May the blessings of Tyr be upon you.
It is part of my duties to provide guidance and advice to my fellow students here at the Academy. Ask your questions.
Many regard Aribeth de Tylmarande as a champion of Tyr and a defender of our faith, but where does she seek salvation during these difficult times? In the works of the wizard Khelben Arunsun!
Knowing this, how can I join the others who praise and fawn over her? But Aribeth has authority in this matter, and I am only a lowly acolyte. So I perform my duties as ordered.
The path of worship is demanding. Only those who are strong in their faith have the strength to persevere and complete their training.
But my faith is strong and true. I live to serve the divine will, and I will not abandon my beliefs as others - like Lady Aribeth - seem to have done.
I have heard many rumors of the plague. Some say it is unnatural, that it was brought about through fell magic by enemies of Neverwinter. But I do not believe this.
The citizens have lost their faith. Even the priests and clerics of the city have faltered. That is why the plague resists our attempts to cure it with prayer and holy magic.
Everyone speaks of the cure discovered by the wizard Khelben Arunsun, but I refuse to abandon my faith and place my hope in works of sorcery.
I believe the Wailing Death is a divine trial, a test of our faith and resolve. Unfortunately, we seem to be failing this test.
We are under attack!
I dare not shed blood in this holy place, so I will ignore your threats. Otherwise I would show you the power of the God I serve! Begone, infidel!
As I said, this is a trial of our faith. People who once worshipped with us now turn against the clergy because we cannot help them. But the fault is theirs, not ours. They are weak in their beliefs.
Ultimately this trial - as all trials of faith - shall pass. Those who hold true to the spiritually divine will survive the plague. The hypocrites will be exposed and shall perish.

For the sake of the city, I hope the cure works, but I suspect the wizard's brew will prove ineffective. And then those who claim to be of my faith but are, in fact, unworthy - like Lady Aribeth - will be exposed.

For the sake of Neverwinter, I hope her folly brings us a cure for the Wailing Death. But in my heart I know the will of the divine alone can save us. Aribeth's misguided efforts will only prolong our suffering.
I would like to receive a lesson in casting spells.
Me want learn how cast spells.
I would like to ask you some questions.
Me want ask you questions.
I am ready for the Trials of Faith.
Me ready for Faith Trial stuff.
Goodbye.
Could you go over the details once more?
Me need you explain faith trial again.
What can you tell me about the plague?
What can you tell me about the cure for the plague?
What you know 'bout plague?
Me want know 'bout cure.
What can you tell me about Lady Aribeth?
What you know 'bout Lady Aribeth.
Got it.
Sorry, I didn't quite understand that.
Me no understand.
Go on.
Could you repeat that?
Me sorry. Me got lost. You say again, 'kay?
Got it.
Sorry, you lost me. Care to try that again?
Me sorry. You say again, please?
Good. Got it.
Sorry, but I missed something there.
Me no get it.
Okay. What else?
I didn't really understand that. Could you go over it again.
Me sorry. Me not understand. You say again, 'kay?
Me not need tutorial, me ready for Trials of Faith.
I don't need your tutorial, I'm ready to face the Trials of Faith.
Ready.
Quickly! You must find and protect the Waterdhavian creatures!
I beseech you to speak with me.
Greetings and well met, <FullName>. I am Elynwyd, faithful servant of Tyr and devotional leader here at the Academy.

No doubt you have come to the chapel to complete your instruction. By all accounts, you have shown great promise in your studies so far. I have no doubt you will do the Academy proud once your training is complete.
Though all are welcome in the chapel to pray and study, <FirstName>, I am surprised to see you here. Normally my visitors are exclusively druids and clerics.
Have you come seeking a lesson in the casting of divine spells, even though you have little need of such learning at the present? Or perhaps you require something else from me?
Greetings once more, <FirstName>. I am surprised to see you back, although you are always welcome. How may I be of aid to you?
You have returned, <FirstName>. Are you prepared to face the Trials of Faith? By completing them your training here at the Academy will be at an end.
Go with the blessings of Tyr, <FirstName>. Your destiny awaits you beyond the Academy's walls.
Your training here is complete, <FirstName>. You should speak with Elynwyd, and then proceed to the south assembly hall to receive blessings and congratulations from Lady Aribeth.
I will begin by showing you how to select your spells. Both clerics and druids use the same procedure in preparing their divine magic.

Before casting a spell, you must first learn to access your spell list. You can't try it now or you'll interrupt our conversation and have to start over. Just listen to what I have to say and you can try it later.
This will bring up your spell list menu. The left side of the menu is a list of all the spells available to you from your deity, the right side is spells you have prayed for and prepared.
Click and drag the spells you want to prepare from your spell list over to your prepared spells page. Don't forget that you'll have to rest before the spells are prepared.
It is very important for a spellcaster to remember to rest. Resting is how you replenish your spells and how we pray to our deity.
Very well, then we shall begin with the most basic principles of the process. I will instruct you as if you yourself were an acolyte who wished to learn the ways of divine magic.
Whenever you rest, your spells will replenish themselves. Lower level spells replenish first and more quickly; higher level spells take longer.
If you have the spells loaded into your quickbar, you will see their icons highlight as they get refreshed. Remember to rest often, but do not forget that you cannot rest while in combat.
Thus endeth the lesson, <FirstName>. I have done all I can, but the rest is up to you. In order to complete your training here at the Academy, you must face the Trials of Faith.
That is all I can teach you of divine magic, <FirstName>, though I do not see what use the knowledge will be to you right now. Is there some other request you have of me?
The test is simple for one whose devotion is true, <FirstName>. Do you see the man by the south wall of the room? You must use your magic to heal his wounds.
The best way to actually cast your spells is by using the quickbar. Remember: you have two extra quickbars that can be accessed using the "SHIFT" and "CTRL" keys.
To load a spell onto your quickbar, simply open your spellbook, then click and drag the spell to the desired slot on one of your quickbars. The spell can now be cast with a single keystroke.
Non-targeted spells will cast automatically after you select them using either the quickbar or the menu system., but many spells require a target - a creature, an object or even a spot on the ground.
After selecting a targeting spell using the quickbar your cursor will change to display the spell icon. To then cast the spell simply left-click with your cursor on the target.
I hope there is nothing amiss, <FirstName>. I see you have not completed the Trials of Faith. Would you like me to describe the tests once more?
Very well, I shall answer your questions to the best of my ability.
The Wailing Death is a terrible affliction upon Neverwinter. The city has been quarantined and sectioned off, yet death tolls continue to rise and infected corpses fill our streets.

There are rumors that someone has brought this plague upon us all for some unholy purpose. However, I doubt anyone could be so evil and callous as to cause such widespread suffering among the innocent.
People have lost their faith. Even Lady Aribeth has turned to the archmage Khelben Arunsun and the cure he claims to have discovered. I wonder at the wisdom of trusting a mage over faith.

Officially I can tell you nothing, but silence only breeds false rumors. Therefore I will share what I know to put you at ease. The archmage Khelben Arunsun claims to have discovered a cure for the Wailing Death.

Nevertheless, Waterdeep has sent us a menagerie of beasts from which to extract the reagents to concoct the cure. Lady Aribeth seems certain this will work, and I must trust her judgment in this matter.

Lady Aribeth is an Elven paladin devoted to Tyr and one of the strongest defenders of our faith. I understand why she has turned to "the Blackstaff" for a cure - I only regret our church could not do more.
Perhaps I will have a chance to speak to her later about my concerns, once she has finished bestowing Tyr's blessings on the graduating students in the south assembly hall.
I pray the wizard's magic proves as powerful as he claims, yet I will also continue to put my faith in the powers of the divine Tyr, rather than an earthly mortal.

As a priest you have a number of special abilities in addition to your divine spells. To access your priestly abilities, simply right-click on yourself and select the special abilites icon on the left of the menu.

As a druid you have a number of special abilities in addition to your divine nature spells. To access your druidic abilities simply right-click on yourself and select the special abilites icon on the left of the menu.
Then, you must use your ability to turn undead to defeat the skeleton on the north wall.
Return to me once the task is complete, <FirstName>. I shall wait here to see how you fare.
This will bring up the special abilities menu. Click on the priestly ability icon in the bottom left of the menu to access your priestly special abilities.
The most important priestly ability you have is the ability to turn undead. Simply click on the icon from the special priest ability menu to use this ability.
This will bring up the special abilities menu. Click on the druidic ability icon in the bottom left of the menu to access your druidic special abilities.
The druid special abilities menu has an icon to summon your animal companion - a powerful ally in battle! As a druid, you should always try to have an animal companion by your side.
Not to worry, <FirstName>, wisdom rarely comes early. I will tell you again.
Certainly. I would not want you to miss out on the pursuit of knowledge through haste or confusion.
Of course, child. We shall repeat until it is as clear as the will of Tyr.
Never fear, I shall go over it again. My patience is a well that never runs dry.
Before you proceed to the Trials of Faith, <FirstName>, I will give you a final tutorial in the casting of divine spells. Ready?
Very well, then we shall dispense with the tutorial and proceed with the Trials of Faith.
Congratulations! You have passed my test. Speak with me before you leave.
To access your spell list, press the "B" key or left-click on the SPELLBOOK icon below your character portrait.
You must speak to Elynwyd in the center of the room before you may undertake the trials of faith.
Only clerics and druids may undertake the trials of faith.
The Academy is under attack! The invaders must be slain!
To complete the Trial of Faith, you must cast a healing spell upon me. When this is done, you must go speak with Elynwyd in the center of the room once more.
You have completed the trials of faith, <FirstName>. You should go to the south assembly hall to join the others at the graduation ceremony.
I have been healed, but you have not completed the other part of the trials of faith.
Sorry, I didn't mean to interrupt.
Me sorry. Me not mean to interrupt.
I think I'll be going now.
What's your problem? I'm just trying to be friendly.
Me go now.
Why you so mad? Me just want be talk at you.
Why do you want to meet Lady Aribeth?
How's your training going?
I want to ask you a few questions.
Why you want meet Aribeth?
How you training going?
Me want ask you some questions.
What can you tell me about the plague?
What can you tell me about those rumors of a cure for the plague?
How do you like training here at the Academy?
What you know 'bout plague?
You hear stuff 'bout cure for plague?
You like training at Academy?
I won't take much of your time. I promise.
Me speak at you quick. Me promise me not use much time.
You better answer my questions if you know what's good for you!
You answer me question or you be sorry!
Can you blame people for losing faith? After all, you can't help them.
Why you mad people lose faith? You not help them anyway.
Why are you disturbing me during my prayers? You are a <class>. You, of all people, should show respect toward my worship and devotional practices.
Can't you see that I'm deep in study of this tome? The Academy might go easy on a <class> like you, but those of us wishing to call upon the divine cannot afford to waste our days chatting.
Greetings yet again. Is there something else you require before I resume my devotional prayers?
Please, I did not mean to give offense. But I have chosen to be a servant of Tyr and with such a choice comes great responsibility. I must attend to my daily worship.
I suppose it would be uncharitable of me to turn you away. But please do not take too much of my time. If I do not finish my devotions I will not be allowed to meet Lady Aribeth.
Then I shall return to my prayers. May the blessings of Tyr be upon you.
I serve Tyr, but it is my duty to also serve my brothers and sisters here at the Academy. Ask your questions and I will do my best to answer.

Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande is a paragon of our faith. She is a devoted servant of Tyr, a sworn defender of Neverwinter and a true champion of justice. Her light shines like a beacon in these dark times.
I pray the graduates gathered in the south assembly hall appreciate what an honor it is to receive a blessing from her in person. It is truly a rare opportunity.
The worship of Tyr is a difficult path, but we who have the faith know the trials of service are their own reward.
And whenever my weak flesh falters, I need only look to Lady Aribeth for inspiration. I hope she has the time to come by the Temple later so I can meet her in person.
I am only a young acolyte in training, yet even the oldest priests at the Temple cannot recall a plague as devastating as the Wailing Death.
The citizens have lost their faith. They have abandoned the spiritual power of the divine, and in their misery they have come to despise all who wear the sacred vestements.
They say the cure was discovered by a mage named Khelben Arunsun, but I sense the hand of Tyr himself working through the mage to bring us salvation.
Neverwinter is gripped by fear, the city quarantined and sectioned off in an attempt to halt the spread of the Wailing Death. Alas, the church can do nothing for these people.
Defend the Waterdhavian creatures!
I do not fear you. Here in the Temple the power of Tyr will keep me safe from all harm. Take your empty threats and leave me be.
People who profess faith only so long as it serves their needs are not true believers, they are hypocrites with false hearts. Who are we to question divine will?
I am confident that the Gods will ease the suffering of Neverwinter if we but hold true to our beliefs. Even now, there is talk of a cure being brought by Lady Aribeth to this city.
I believe it was the will of Tyr that brought Khelben and Lady Aribeth together to save Neverwinter. I hope I get a chance to meet Lady Aribeth while she is here at the Academy.
Ketta sent me to get a key from you.
Ketta say me need get key from you.
Nothing. Goodbye.
Maybe we could work out some kind of deal?
Maybe Bruno and me make deal.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> It's okay, Bruno. Ketta thinks you need a break. She said I could watch the key for a while.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> It okay, Bruno. Ketta say you need a break. She say me could watch key for while.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> You give me the key, Bruno, and I'll make sure you get my dessert at the mess hall tonight.
<StartCheck>[Persuade]</Start> Bruno give me key and later me give Bruno dessert at mess hall.
You need got speak to Ketta. She be one in charge here.
You talk at Ketta? She short but she nice. She give Bruno extra food at supper. Sometime she give me cake and stuff. What you want?
You not talk at Bruno no more! You gonna graduate. You need go to south assembly hall for meet Aribeth. She be pretty.
Bruno wave bye-bye now.
No, no, no. Ketta tell me not give to nobody. Bruno, she say, you keep key safe. Me get extra dessert tonight if me keep key safe for Ketta.
Deal? What you mean deal?
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Ketta say that? For true? Okay, here be key - me go on break now.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Me not believe you! You not got enough Persuade skill to trick Bruno like that! Ketta give me extra dessert if me keep key safe!
<StartCheck>[Success]</Start> Bruno like dessert. Okay, you got deal! Here be key! Me be going now. Me see you again at supper when you give Bruno you dessert.
<StartCheck>[Failure]</Start> Me not like you deal! Me no give you key! You not real good at persuading, am you? You need more skill or people no listen to you. You go away now.
What you want? You here to get key from Bruno? Me got it safe right here... what? Key gone! Where be Bruno key? Someone take me key!
This not good. Ketta not be happy with me. Bruno better go now or Ketta maybe yell at him.
Help! We be attacked! You gots protect Waterdeep creatures!
I would like to receive a lesson in rogue skills.
Me want learn how be sneaky.
I would like to ask you some questions.
Me want ask you questions.
I am ready for your challenges.
Me ready for challenge.
Goodbye.
Could you go over the details of the challenge once more?
Me need you explain again.
What can you tell me about the plague?
What do you know about the cure for the plague?
What you know 'bout plague?
Me want know 'bout cure for plague.
What can you tell me about Lady Aribeth?
What you know 'bout Lady Aribeth.
Simple.
Sorry, I didn't quite get that. Could you repeat yourself?
Me not understand. You tell me again, kay?
Got it.
Can you repeat that?
Maybe you say that again, 'kay?
Okay. What else?
Would you be able to go over all that again?
Me want you say that again, please.
Right.
Could you go over that again?
Me need you tell me that again.
Go on.
I didn't understand that last part.
Me no get what you just say.
I understand.
Me understand.
Could you go over that persuasion bit again, please?
Me want you tell me 'bout persuade again.
I don't need your tutorial. Let's just jump to the challenges.
Me not need you tutorial. Me just want go right to challenge.
Ready.
We're under attack! Don't let them get the Waterdhavian creatures!
Come on over here. We need to have a chat.
Hi there. My name's Ketta, head of Security, Espionage and Intrigue here at the Academy. No need to tell me who you are; my sources are way ahead of you. You're <FullName>, ain't ya?
Now I know you're not one of those prissy types who frowns on a little sneaky skullduggery. I mean, that's why you're here, ain't it? To learn the ins and outs of the rogue's life.
My sources never figured you as the type to go in for this whole creeping cloak and dagger bit, <FirstName>, but maybe we had you pegged wrong.
So, are you interested in learning a little about the arts of those who operate on the shady side of the law, or do you need something else?
Back again, <FirstName>? Not sure what you need. You're no rogue, so there's not much I can teach you in that department. So what do you need?
Back again, <FirstName>? So, you ready to test your mettle against one of my challenges? If you can pull off this job you're finally free, and your sentence here at the Academy will be at an end.
See you 'round.
What are you doing back here, <FirstName>? You're done, it's over, you made it! You better get down to the south assembly hall if you want to get that blessing from Lady Aribeth.
Well, don't worry, you've come to the best. I know all the tricks of the trade, and I'm going to teach them to you.

Let's start with something simple, like picking a lock. This only works if you have ranks in the Pick Lock skill. Simply right-click on the door or container and select the "Pick Lock" icon from the menu.
Some locks may be beyond your ability to open, but using a lockpick increases your chances. Simply right-click on the lockpick, select the Use icon, then left-click on the door to use the pick.

Okay, let's look at another basic rogue skill. Suppose you want to disarm, recover or flag a trap so other players can see it. Just right-click on the door or container and select the trap icon, then select your action from the trap menu.
Remember, you have to detect a trap before you can disarm it! You'll know a trap is still active if it shows up as bright red. Again, this will only work if you have ranks in the Disable Traps skill.
Ah, I knew it! Everyone's a rogue at heart, right? Okay, listen up and I'll go over it all for you.
Let's look at how to pick pockets. Remember, this only works if you have ranks in the Pick Pocket skill.
Start by right-clicking on your victim to bring up the menu. Now select the pick pocket icon from the lower left of the menu.
Hey, relax. There's nothing to it. All you have to do is bring me the key from inside that chest on the east wall. Of course, it's locked and the key's inside, so you'll have to pick the lock.
When you successfully pick someone's pocket you have a chance to get a random item from their inventory or a chance to come away with some of their gold.
Just be careful. I can tell you from past experience that people don't like catching you with your hand in their pocket!
A rogue needs to know how to move without being seen or heard: there's a real art to sneaking.
Your Stealth ability is a combination of your Hide and Move Silently skills. While in Stealth mode creatures must make an opposed check based on their Spot and Listen skills in order to detect you.

To activate Stealth mode right click on yourself and select the icon on the left to bring up your special ability menu. From this menu simply select Stealth. Your character will become semi-transparent while in Stealth mode.

There are a number of factors that affect "Stealth Mode." Your rank in the Hide and Move Silently skills, shadows and lighting in the area, and line of sight of nearby enemies all affect your ability to use "Stealth Mode."
Is there a problem, <FirstName>? You having a little trouble with the challenge? You want me to go over it one more time?
Questions, eh? I always get antsy when someone starts interrogating me. But I don't see any harm in telling you what you want to know. Okay, shoot.

I'm not supposed to talk about the plague with the students anymore. Seems like the higher ups think I'm the one responsible for starting those conspiracy theories running rampant through the barracks.
But I know this plague was no accident! My spy network hasn't been able to find out who caused it, or why. But if my sources are accurate at least help is on the way.

Seems that archmage Khelben Arunsun has come up with a cure, according to reports delivered to Lady Aribeth. Not that I was spying on her, you understand. I was just snooping around for practice, you know?
You're learning quick, <FirstName>. When you want the real scoop, you come to me. I know all about Khelben Arunsun and the Waterdhavian creatures.
I think that's the real reason Lady Aribeth is here today, to keep an eye on those Waterdhavian creatures and make sure nothing happens to them.
That Elf has her good and bad points. She's smart and tough and gets the job done, but she's a goody-goody paladin of Tyr. She's always getting upset at me for "borrowing" her things.
I got a funny feeling she'll be coming to speak to me about a certain missing comb once she finishes handing out blessings to the graduating students in the south assembly hall.
Seems the archmage has figured out how to brew a cure for the Wailing Death using reagents gathered from strange and exotic monsters, monsters that have been brought to the Academy for safekeeping.
While in "Stealth Mode" you won't be able to move faster than a walk. If you want to run again, you'll have to click on "Stealth Mode" to turn it off.
Or you can bring me the key from the chest behind the door in the north wall of this room. The chest isn't locked, but you'll have to find and disarm the trap on the door before you can get inside.
Or you can bring me the key held by my rather dense assistant Bruno standing over there in the corner. Don't hurt him, mind you!

Now would also be a good time to tell you about the rogue's Sneak Attack ability. Rogues get a bonus on To-Hit rolls as well as multipliers to damage when launching surprise attacks at an opponent's flank.
You could try to pick his pocket or, if you're a real sweet talker, you might be able to persuade him to hand it over to you.
The choice is yours: the lock, the trap or Bruno. Bring me any one of those keys and you pass the test.
Hey, I never give up. We'll just keep trying until we get it right. I call it persistence, though others just call it recidivism.
Stuck on traps, are we? Ha-ha! Just a little rogue humor there. Sorry. I'll explain it again.
No harm in retracing our steps, is there? Plus, it helps to confuse the search parties.
That's okay, I don't mind going over it again. More stage time for me, right?
Don't get the wrong idea. Sometimes all the lockpicking and sneak attacks in the world won't get the job done. That's when we rogues have to be as quick with our speech as we are with our hands.

Often during dialog you'll have a chance to persuade somebody to give you more information or perform a certain task. The higher your rank is in the Persuade skill, the better your chance of fast-talking your way through a situation.
A high charisma also helps with persuasion - the more attractive and likeable you are, the more people are willing to believe you.
I think I could be 'persuaded'! Oh, that was a stinker. Forget I even said that.
Well, I guess that's it. We've pretty much plumbed the depths of my knowledge, and you soaked it all up like a sponge.
I've got some challenges to test your skills, if you think you're up to them. It's the last step in your training before we graduate you from the Academy.
Well, I guess that's it. We've pretty much plumbed the depths of my knowledge, and you soaked it all up like a sponge. Now, is there anything else I can do for you?
I see you've got the key on you. Well done, <FirstName>! Let me be the first to congratulate you. Your work here at the Academy is all but done.
Now, unless there was something else you needed, you had better get down to the south assembly hall if you want to get that blessing from Lady Aribeth.
Consider this a final tutorial before you tackle the Academy's final challenge. Everything you wanted to know about rogues but were afraid to ask. Ready?
Well, you wouldn't be the first to skip the tutorial and jump right into the action. And I see you're chomping at the bit to get this done.
You passed the test but don't get too cocky. Come and talk to me before you leave.
How do you know my name?
How you know me name?
I think I'll be going now.
Sorry, you must have me confused with someone else.
Me go now.
Me think you not know me. You thinking of some other one.
Why are you so interested in Lady Aribeth?
How's your training going, Shade?
Can I ask you some questions?
Why you want spy on Aribeth?
How you training going, Shade?
Me want ask you some questions.
What can you tell me about the plague?
Have you heard those rumors about a cure for the plague?
How do you like training here at the Academy?
What you know 'bout plague?
You hear stuff 'bout cure for plague?
You like training at Academy?
I thought you were just a spy!
Me thought you just be spy!
Sounds like you've got a crush on her.
It sound like you maybe love her.
Don't worry - I still want to get together.
You no worry - me still want see you later.
Actually, I can't get together with you later after all.
Me sorry. Me no can see you later.
Forget it, Shade. I'm not going to date someone who's been stalking me.
Flattery. I like it.
No offense, but I'm not interested.
Me like what you say.
Me here for training! Me not care 'bout this stuff!
Me no want date man who be stalking me.
Actually I'm not seeing anyone right now.
That's really none of your business.
Me not seeing anyone right now.
That not be none of you business!
I'd like that, Shade.
Sorry, but I'm not interested.
Uh... I'm already going with somebody. Sorry, Shade.
Me like that, Shade.
Me not interested. Sorry.
Uh... me got date already. Sorry, Shade.
Back off, you creepy little freak!
Me not like you! You be creepy freak boy!
Can I ask you some questions?
Me want ask you some questions.
What are you talking about?
What you mean by that?
Goodbye.
Where can I find Silk?
Where Silk be?
Hello, <FirstName>. You don't know me, but you can just call me Shade.
Back again, <FirstName>? Need to pick my brain one more time, or is there something else?
Don't worry, it's nothing sinister. Just a little harmless spying on my part. Ketta says I need to practice my espionage skills. I've been watching you for quite some time.
But now that you're almost done with your training here at the Academy I'm going to have to find someone else to spy on. Hmmm... maybe Lady Aribeth would make a nice target.
Farewell then, <FirstName>. Perhaps I will see you again, though you might not see me.
Please, <FirstName>, if you don't want to talk, just say so, but don't play me for a fool. I know exactly who you are.
Of course. Normally an Academy spy charges to distribute information, but since I'm still technically in training I guess I could answer a few questions for free.
If you're going to spy on someone it might as well be someone in charge, right? Aribeth knows a lot more about this plague then she's letting on. You can't blame me for being curious.
Of course if I get caught they'll probably expel me... or worse. But the danger is part of the appeal. And Aribeth is a beautiful woman. Some might say that alone is reason enough to spy on her.
I spend my days hidden in the shadows and my nights veiled in darkness. The life of a spy is a lonely one, I'm afraid.
And yet it has a hold on me I cannot break free of. To follow someone who doesn't know you are there, to study him or her when they think they are safe and alone. It's a feeling like no other.
To know you hold the life of the one you watch in your hands, that at any moment your orders may change and force you to become not a spy but an assassin... forgive me, I've said too much.
Don't be so naive, <FirstName>. There is a dark side to espionage. Assassination is an unpleasant but at times very necessary aspect of the job.
Let's just say I'm intrigued. Does the famous paladin have a *naughty* side? Besides, a powerful, beautiful woman like Aribeth can turn any man's head.
Surely you must know that, <FirstName>. While spying on you I've seen it happen many times. After all, you're a powerful and beautiful woman yourself.

Well, I could go into grisly detail about the bodies in the streets, or give you a gruesome description of the symptoms of the Wailing Death and the stages of the affliction as it ravages its victims.

Mark my words, the Wailing Death is no accident. A plague that the priests can't cure? That sounds like wizards' work to me! Of course I haven't found any evidence to back up my theory yet, but I'll keep digging until I do.

Of course I've heard the rumors. I am a spy, after all. They say Khelben Arunsun gave a cure to Lady Aribeth. I bet that's why she's here at the Academy right now. Maybe I should try tailing her to see what I can turn up.
Ah, we meet again <FirstName>. I hope you aren't coming to tell me you're having second thoughts about our little rendezvous later this evening.

But I suspect we've all had our fill of such things. Besides, I'm much more interested in who or what might be behind the plague. Ketta's had me gathering information on possible conspiracies to bring down Neverwinter!
But Aribeth is already involved with somebody. A priest named Fenthick. And what about you, <FirstName>? I haven't seen a man in your life since I've been watching you.
But I'm only interested in her from a professional perspective. You, however, are a woman of character. I find you very... fascinating.
As you wish. Some women are threatened by my line of work. I thought you were the type who welcomed a little excitement in her life but I see I was mistaken. Is there anything else you need?
I find that hard to believe - a fascinating woman like you without a man in her life.
I do apologize, but you must remember that it's my job to be interested in things that are not my business. Particularly when they involve such a fascinating woman as yourself.
There's a feast for the graduates later this evening. Would you like to accompany me to the celebration? It's a chance for you to learn as much about me as I already know about you.
I promise you an evening you'll remember for the rest of your life. I won't say any more. Best to let the mystery and anticipation build. Is there anything else I can do for you?
Then farewell until the feast. Don't worry, I promise tonight will be the most memorable evening of your life.
Stalking? All I did was spy on you and follow you and learn as many secret things about you as I could. That is my job, after all. You should consider it a form of flattery.
This must be a very recent development, or I would already have known about it. Ah, well. My hesitation has cost me my chance, I suppose. Is there anything else I can do for you?
But I am still in training and so far Ketta has limited my tasks to simple reconaissance. Perhaps once I've proved myself Ketta will let me try my spying skills on Lady Aribeth herself.
Don't worry, <FirstName>, spying on you was just harmless practice. The Academy would never have me eliminate another student, especially not one as talented and beautiful as you.
Don't worry, <FirstName>, spying on you was just harmless practice. The Academy would never have me eliminate another student, especially not one as talented and capable as you.
Protect the Waterdhavian creatures!
You made it mighty clear how things are between us. I don't see any reason to talk to someone who considers me a 'creepy little freak'.
Excellent. I promise you an evening you'll never forget as long as you live. Is there something else I can do for you in the meantime?
I see. Obviously you have made up your mind about me. Well, don't worry, I won't bother you again. And I won't be following you any more, either.
Ah, yes, I know you. You're <FirstName>. Silk has had her eye on you.
Farewell, <FirstName>. No doubt Silk will be seeing you soon - though you might not see her.
I really thought you would have figured it out by now. Silk has been spying on you, <FirstName>. It's part of her training.
It really isn't my place to say any more. You should really speak to Silk about this.
Hmmm... there might be some questions you ask that I really shouldn't answer, especially if they concern my fellow students.
She's over there in the northeast alcove of the room. She's been watching you this whole time.
How do you know my name?
How you know me name?
I think I'll be going now.
Sorry, you must have me confused with someone else.
Me go now.
Me think you not know me. You thinking of some other one.
Why are you so interested in Lady Aribeth?
How's your training going, Silk?
Can I ask you some questions?
Why you want spy on Aribeth?
How you training going, Silk?
Me want ask you some questions.
What can you tell me about the plague?
Have you heard those rumors about a cure for the plague?
How do you like training here at the Academy?
What you know 'bout plague?
You hear stuff 'bout cure for plague?
You like training at Academy?
I thought you were just a spy!
Me thought you just be spy!
Sounds like you're a little jealous.
It sound like you maybe jealous.
Don't worry - I still want to get together.
You no worry - me still want see you later.
Actually, I can't get together with you later after all.
Me sorry. Me no can see you later.
Forget it, Silk. I'm not interested in someone who's been stalking me.
I find dangerous women *very* interesting.
You're really not my type, Silk.
Me like danger type girls.
Me not be interested in that kind of woman!
Me no want date girl who be stalking me.
That's kind of a personal question.
That not be none of you business!
I'd like that, Silk.
Sorry, but I'm not interested.
Uh... I'm already going with somebody. Sorry, Silk.
Me like that, Silk.
Me not interested. Sorry.
Uh... me got date already. Sorry, Silk.
Back off, you psychotic freak!
Me not like you! You be psycho freak girl!
Can I ask you some questions?
Me want ask you some questions.
What are you talking about?
What you mean by that?
Goodbye.
Where can I find Shade?
Where Shade be?
Hello, <FirstName>. You don't know me, but you can just call me Silk.
Back again, <FirstName>? Need to pick my brain one more time, or is there something else?
Don't worry, it's nothing sinister. Just a little harmless spying on my part. Ketta says I need to practice my espionage skills. I've been watching you for quite some time.
But now that you're almost done your training here at the Academy I'm going to have to find someone else to spy on. Hmmm... maybe Lady Aribeth would make a nice target.
Farewell then, <FirstName>. Perhaps I will see you again, though you might not see me.
Please, <FirstName>, if you don't want to talk, just say so, but don't play me for a fool. I know exactly who you are.
Normally an Academy spy charges to distribute information, but since I'm still technically in training I guess I could answer a few questions for free.
If you're going to spy on someone, it might as well be someone in charge, right? Aribeth knows a lot more about this plague then she's letting on. You can't blame me for being curious.
Of course, if I get caught, they'll probably expel me... or worse, but the danger is part of the appeal. Besides, maybe I'll finally figure out why so many men seem infatuated with that woman.
I spend my days hidden in the shadows and my nights veiled in darkness. The life of a spy is a lonely one, I'm afraid.
And yet it has a hold on me I cannot break free of. To follow someone who doesn't know you are there, to study them when they think they are safe and alone - it's a feeling like no other.
To know you hold the life of the one you watch in your hands, that at any moment your orders may change and force you to become not a spy but an assassin... forgive me, I've said too much.
Don't be so naive, <FirstName>. There is a dark side to espionage. Assassination is an unpleasant but at times very necessary aspect of the job.
Let's just say I'm confused. Why would anyone be interested in that paladin? Honor, duty, virtue - boring. What's the appeal? Don't men want a woman who's a little bit... mysterious?
Tell me the truth, <FirstName>. What do you want in a woman? A goody-two shoes paladin, or someone a bit... naughty? A girl who knows secrets? A woman who is... dangerous?

Well, I could go into grisly detail about the bodies in the streets, or give you a gruesome description of the symptoms of the Wailing Death and the stages of the affliction as it ravages its victims.

Mark my words, the Wailing Death is no accident. A plague that the priests can't cure? That sounds like wizards' work to me! Of course I haven't found any evidence to back up my theory yet, but I'll keep digging until I do.

Of course I've heard the rumors. I am a spy, after all. They say Khelben Arunsun gave a cure to Lady Aribeth. I bet that's why she's here at the Academy right now. Maybe I should try tailing her to see what I can turn up.
Ah, we meet again <FirstName>. I hope you aren't coming to tell me you're having second thoughts about our little rendezvous later this evening.

But I suspect we've all had our fill of such things. Besides, I'm much more interested in who or what might be behind the plague. Ketta's had me gathering information on possible conspiracies to bring down Neverwinter!
I understand. Some men are threatened by my line of work. I thought you were the type who welcomed a little excitement in his life but I see I was mistaken. Is there anything else you need?
I'm sorry, but it's my job to be interested in things that are none of my business. Besides, being a bad girl is part of my charm. Doesn't it make me more interesting?
You'll be leaving the Academy soon - why don't we get together tonight? After the graduation ceremonies. Just the two of us. You can learn some of my secrets for a change.
I promise it will be an evening you'll remember for the rest of your life. I won't say anymore - best to let the mystery and anticipation build. Is there anything else I can do for you?
I'll see you after the feast, then. Don't worry, I promise tonight will be the most memorable evening of your life.

Stalking? All I did was spy on you and follow you and learn as many secret things about you as I could. That is my job, after all. I've already admitted I'm a spy - even if that does make it dangerous to trust me.
Really? How come I don't know about this? It must be a very recent development. That's too bad - it would have been a night to remember. Ah, well. Is there anything else I can do for you?
But I am still in training and so far Ketta has limited my tasks to simple reconaissance. Perhaps once I've proved myself Ketta will let me try my spying skills on Lady Aribeth herself.
Don't worry, <FirstName>. Spying on you was just harmless practice. The Academy would never have me eliminate another student. I'm dangerous, but not *that* dangerous.
Don't worry, <FirstName>. Spying on you was just harmless practice. The Academy would never have me eliminate another student. I'm dangerous, but not *that* dangerous.
Protect the Waterdhavian creatures!
You made it clear how things are between us. I don't see any reason to talk to someone who considers me a 'psychotic freak'.
Excellent. I promise you an evening you'll never forget as long as you live. Is there something else I can do for you in the meantime?
I see. Obviously you have made up your mind about me. Well, don't worry - I won't bother you again. And I won't be following you anymore, either.
Ah, yes, I know you. You're <FirstName>. Shade has had his eye on you.
Farewell, <FirstName>. No doubt Shade will be seeing you soon - though you might not see him.
I really thought you would have figured it out by now. Shade has been spying on you, <FirstName>. It's part of his training.
It really isn't my place to say anymore. You should really speak to Shade about this.
Hmmm... there might be some questions you ask that I really shouldn't answer. Especially if they concern my fellow students.
He's over there on the south wall of the room. He's been watching you this whole time.

I have to confess that since I started spying on you I've become a little bit obsessed. Hazard of the job, I guess. But I couldn't help wondering what it would be like to get to know you more... intimately.
Aren't you going to help me?
You not be help me?
I will do as you command, Lady Aribeth!
Me do as you say!
Why should I listen to you?
You not boss of me. Me do what me want.
Enemies? Who are these enemies you speak of?
Enemies? Who they be?
Everyone at the Academy seemed to know about the Waterdhavian creatures.
Me hear lots people talk 'bout Water-thingy monsters.
But the attackers are all dead. The threat is over, isn't it?
But all bad mans be dead. We safe now, right?
Where can I find these creatures, Lady Aribeth?
Wait a minute, you're not coming with me?
Where me find creatures?
It sound like you not be going with me?
I will do as you command, Lady Aribeth!
Me do as you say.
Why should I listen to you?
You not boss of me. Me do what me want.
I'll do it - but the reward better be worth the trouble!
Me do it 'cause you give me lots gold later.
I'll do it, but the reward had better be worth the trouble.
Me do it, but only 'cause you give me lots gold later.
Congratulations. Your training here at the Academy is now complete. May the blessing of Tyr be upon you.
I have been looking forward to meeting you, <FirstName>. The instructors here at the Academy speak very highly of your skills. I am Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande.
Perhaps after the graduation ceremonies we can speak in private. Neverwinter can use a good <man/woman> like you.
We are under attack! Destroy the invaders!
I must speak with you!
Listen to me, <FirstName>, there is not much time. I fear this is no random attack we have suffered.
Do not waste any more time speaking to me! Quickly, you must find the Waterdhavian creatures. Do not let them be taken by the invaders!
Hurry! Make your way into the hall and then to the chambers down the east corridor. That is where the Waterdhavian beasts are kept.
By accompanying you, I will only make your task more difficult. Our attackers appeared here in this room. It is likely their arrival was magically centered on me.
Our enemy must have assumed I would be with the Waterdhavian creatures. Even now they may be watching me through magical means, hoping I will lead them right to the creatures.
I must stay here. Hopefully the attackers, and any reinforcements, will be drawn to me here in this room. This may allow you to save the creatures.
The lives of thousands of innocent people hang in the balance! If the creatures are lost, the cure for the Wailing Death will be lost with them!
But if that is not enough to garner your loyalty, know that you will be greatly rewarded if you manage to save the Waterdhavian creatures.
The fate of Neverwinter depends on you, <FirstName>. The key will open the door. May Tyr be with you!
As you may already know, a number of creatures were brought from Waterdeep here to the Academy. It was believed the reagents for a spell to create a cure could be extracted from them.
We tried to keep this information secret. But this attack reveals our secret is well known, even to our enemies.
I fear the entire Academy is under assault. Listen, can you not hear the faint echoes of battle coming from distant halls?
Rumors spread more quickly than the plague itself, or so it would seem. But what is done cannot be undone, we must focus on the task at hand.
Neverwinter has many enemies. Some declare themselves openly, such as the city of Luskan. Others keep their identities hidden from us, striking from the shadows.
I do not know who is behind this attack, but it is obvious they are here to destroy our hope of ending the Wailing Death.
You must protect the Waterdhavian creatures, <FirstName>! They must not be allowed to fall into the enemy's hands!
I would take you to the creatures myself if I could. But I fear my presence would make protecting the creatures more difficult, if not impossible.
Our attackers appeared here in this room. It is likely their arrival was magically centered on me. They must have assumed I would be with the Waterdhavian creatures.
Even now our enemy may be watching me through magical means, hoping I will lead them right to where the creatures are kept. I cannot take that risk.
You must do this alone, <FirstName>. Go back through the hallway leading to this room and take the corridor to the east. It leads to the chambers where the Waterdhavian beasts are being kept.
Take this key, <FirstName>, it will open the locked door back in the hallway leading to this room. I will stay here; hopefully my presence will draw the enemy away from the creatures they seek.
The lives of thousands of innocent people hang in the balance! If the creatures are lost a cure for the Wailing Death will be lost with them!
But if that is not enough to garner your loyalty, know that you will be greatly rewarded if you manage to save the Waterdhavian creatures.
Perhaps after the graduation ceremonies we can speak in private. Neverwinter can use a good <man/woman> like you.
We should arrange... wait! What was that? Did you feel it, <FirstName>? Brace yourself, we are under attack!
As director of the Academy let me offer you congratulations on completing your training, <FirstName>.
The instructors speak highly of you, <FirstName>. Rarely has a <class> shown such promise so early in their career.
Forgive me, but I am too busy with the proceedings to chat right now. We have a large number of graduates today, all eager to receive their blessings from Lady Aribeth.
If you have not already done so, you should go see Lady Aribeth so that you may receive congratulations and her personal blessing.
We are under attack! Protect the Waterdhavian creatures!
Defend the Academy! For the glory of Tyr!
Truly, we have reached a great milestone in our lives. Long have I prayed for this day.
And Tyr has answered my prayers with a great bounty, a blessing from Lady Aribeth herself! Be certain you speak with her, lest you miss out on receiving your own blessing.
Lady Aribeth truly is a paragon of virtue and a stalwart defender of Tyr's justice, is she not? I even hear she has discovered a cure for the Wailing Death.
I thank my divine lord Tyr for giving me the chance to meet Aribeth in person. You must hurry and speak to her or you will miss out on receiving your blessing.
The Academy is under attack! To arms! To arms!
I never thought I'd make it to graduation. I still have nightmares of Herban screaming at me during basic training!
But the chance to meet Lady Aribeth makes it all worth it in the end. Make sure you get up there, you don't want to miss out on getting your blessing.
I heard Lady Aribeth isn't here just for the graduation ceremony. I heard she's brought a cure for the Wailing Death to the Academy for safekeeping!
But I don't really care why she's here, I'm just glad I got the chance to meet her. You should really get up there or you'll miss out on getting your blessing.
Blast the invaders into dust! Char their bones with magic fire!
Lady Aribeth understands that arcane magic isn't to be feared. She actually respects wizards instead of fearing them like most of the people in Neverwinter.
It's an honor to actually meet someone as famous as Aribeth. You better go speak to her yourself, or you won't receive your blessing.
I hear Lady Aribeth is friends with Khelben Arunsun, the famous archmage from Waterdeep. Together they're working on a cure for the Wailing Death.
It's an honor to meet someone who actually knows Khelben. You should go speak to Aribeth too, so you can receive a blessing from her hand.
A sneak attack! We must slay the enemy!
Isn't this exciting? We actually get a chance to meet Lady Aribeth!
Most paladins want nothing to do with rogues and spies, but she's actually here in person! You better get up there or you'll miss your chance to get your blessing from her.
There's whispers around the Academy that Lady Aribeth is just using the graduation as a cover. They say she's really come to the Academy with a cure for the Wailing Death.
Pretty sneaky... for a paladin. Say, you better stop chatting with me and get up there or you'll miss out on your blessing.
What's this? I was expecting Aribeth, not some wet-behind-the-ears <class>!
Let's see how you deal with my minions, fool!
I see you are strong. A little too strong for my taste!
I think we need to change your tactics.
I think I'll do better off on my own.
We need to change the distance you stay away from me.
Six feet.
Twelve feet.
Eighteen feet.
Nevermind.
Could you alter your spell casting practices?
I want you to use your most powerful spells first.
Try to overpower monster with higher level spells.
Try to user appropriately powered spells for the monsters we fight.
Could we change how quickly you decide to heal me.
Heal me if I become somewhat injured (below 75% of total hit points).
Heal me if I become wounded (below 50% of total hit points).
Heal me if I become seriously wounded (below 25% of total hit points).
Could you not search all the time?
Could you please search when we move around?
Could you use more stealth when we travel?
Could you stop being so stealthy all the time?
If I fail to open a locked door or chest, please come to my aid.
If I fail to open a locked door or chest, do not assist me.
I don't want to change anything else right now.
We need change way you do stuff.
Me no want you here no more.
You change how far away you stay.
You need change how you shoot spells.
You need change how you heal me.
You not search all time no more.
You search all time when we move.
You stop sneaking so quiet now.
You start sneak quiet now.
If me fail on locked door or chest, you help me.
If me fail on locked door or chest, you not help me.
Me not want change anything else now.
Use you most powerful spells first.
You try overpower monster with higher level spells.
You try use strong spells on strong baddies and weak spells on weak baddies.
You heal if me sort of hurt (below 75% of total hit points).
You heal if me wounded (below 50% of total hit points).
You heal if me hurt real bad (below 25% of total hit points).
Yes. Go.
No. Stay.
Okay, join up with me.
Okay, you be join up with me.
Sorry, not interested.
Join up?
Yes, <FirstName>, is there something you need?
If you feel that's best. What would you like to change?
How far away do you want me to stay?
Certainly. How would you like me to cast my spells?
Of course. How soon would you like me to heal you?
Please don't send me away! I'll never make it out of here alive on my own! You're not really going to abandon me, are you?
Thank the gods you're here, <FirstName>. I thought those goblins were going to be the death of me!
It's me, Pavel! Remember? This whole place is crawling with enemies - they killed my brother, Bim! Please, <FirstName>, you have to let me join up with you.
Okay, you're the boss.
I... I can't go on by myself. I'm not cut out for this. Please <FirstName>, if you reconsider... come find me here.
If you feel that's best. What would you like to change?
How far away do you want me to stay?
Very well, I shall stay six feet away from you whenever possible.
Very well, I shall stay 12 feet away from you whenever possible.
Very well, I shall stay 18 feet away from you whenever possible.
Is there anything else?
Was there anything else?
Very well, I shall hold nothing back and use my most powerful spells first.
Very well, I will attack creatures with spells I feel will overwhelm them with their power.
Very well, I will cast my spells in accordance with the difficulty of our enemy.
I shall do as you have asked.
Very well, I will no longer search while we are moving.
Very well, I will search whenever we are moving.
Very well, I will travel in stealth mode from now on.
Very well, I will no longer travel in stealth mode.
Very well, I will open any locked door or chest that you fail to open.
Very well, I will no longer attempt to open locked doors or chests.
Everybody needs help from someone once in a while, someone with skills you don't have. Or sometimes you just need some extra muscle or magical firepower.
That's why most towns have places you can go to hire henchmen to join up with you. When you talk to them, they'll be quick to offer their services for a fee.
But I'm not asking you to pay me anything. I just want to join up with you so I can avenge Bim's death... and maybe get out of here alive.
You're my only chance to get out of here alive, <FirstName>! And I won't be any trouble - please let me join up with you!
I'll follow you and use my skills to help you out. If you ever want to give me more specific instructions, just speak to me. I'll change my tactics accordingly.
I've got a mind of my own, but you're the one in charge. I'll need your help, too. If I get hurt, I might need you to heal me.
Thank you, <FirstName>! Together we've got at least half a chance.
I need to speak to you!
I'm ready to learn how to level up.
Me ready for learn how level up.
Could you teach me how to level up?
You teach me how level up.
I don't need you to teach me how to level up.
Me not need you teach me how level up!
Ready.
Can you go over that again?
Me need you say that again.
Please continue.
Can you go over that again?
Me want you go over that stuff again.
Simple enough.
You lost me.
I must speak to you.
Many fierce enemies await you beyond this door. You will need to draw upon all you have learned here at the Academy to survive.

You have gained much experience, <FirstName>, but to put that experience to use I must first teach you how to level up. Leveling up is how you gain access to greater hit points, skills, feats and spells.
Then we shall begin the lesson.
To level up you must first access your character record sheet. Don't do this now or you'll end our conversation. You'll have to listen to the instructions then try it when we're done speaking.

You can access your character sheet by pressing "C" on your keyboard, by left-clicking the CHAR box beneath your portrait or through the menu. Remember, you'll have to wait until after our conversation is over to do this. Are you ready to continue?
Greetings once more, <FirstName>. I see you have not yet leveled up. You must do this before you can pass through the south door.
As you wish. You may pass through the south door only after you have leveled up.
Well, I was going to give you additional lessons on how to Level Up, but you have already managed just fine. I have nothing more I can teach you, <FirstName>.
I am too old to go with you, but the south door is now open for you. Beyond you will find chambers leading to the Waterdhavian creatures... if the attackers have not taken them already.
Whenever you have enough experience points to go up to another level you will see a flashing LEVEL UP box at the center of your character record sheet. Left-click this box to begin your level up.
You can cancel the level up process at any time by left-clicking on the CANCEL box on the level up screen. To level up, first select the class you wish to gain a level in.

You can have levels in up to three different classes. Some classes may not be available to you because of alignment restrictions. After selecting the class you wish to gain a level in, click the OK box.

After selecting the class to level up in, the SKILLS page appears. Click on a skill to assign a skill point and gain a rank in that specific skill. Or, if you wish, you can click the RECOMMENDED box in the bottom left.
This will automatically assign your skill points in a pre-selected default package based on your class and level. When you are done with the SKILLS page click OK.

This will bring up the FEATS page, if you have any new feats available. Available feats are listed in a menu on the left. Click the arrow beside a feat and it will move to the "Known Feats" menu on the right. Again you can click the RECOMMENDED box for a default package.
Then I shall go over it once more. After all, this is important.

Depending on your class and level other pages will also appear during the level up process. Using the mouse you may have to select new spells, assign ability point increases, or choose a new familiar or animal companion.
Simply follow along each page and click OK when you are finished. At any time you can click the CANCEL box to quit the process and start over.
This is the end of our lesson, <FirstName>. Only once you have leveled up will you be able to pass through the south door.
I have come from Lady Aribeth. She sent me to protect the creatures.
Me come from Lady Aribeth. She send me for protect the creatures.
I told you bringing the creatures to the Academy was a mistake, Fenthick! They would have been safer with my Helmites!
Your Helmite brethren could not have done anymore to protect the Waterdhavian creatures, Desther. The enemy numbers were too great.
How did they know the Waterdhavian beasts had been brought to the Academy, Desther? Is there a traitor among us?
Everyone knew, Fenthick! The students here could talk of nothing else! My Helmites would have been more discrete!
Do not waste your time looking for a traitor or spy, Fenthick. We have only to blame the gossiping mouths of the Academy students.
Listen - the sounds of battle coming from the Academy have faded. The enemy has been defeated, the assailants are all slain or driven off.
My Helmites could have kept their arrival secret, unlike the students here. You let your feelings for Aribeth sway you in this matter, Fenthick.
But at what cost, Fenthick? The Waterdhavian creatures are gone - as is all hope for a cure!
We must not give up hope, Desther. The creatures escaped into the city during the confusion of the battle. Perhaps... perhaps we may yet find them once more.
And what of the students at the Academy? Only a handful remain - the rest have been slaughtered because Aribeth foolishly thought the creatures would be safe here.
All is lost, Fenthick. The nymph has fled; the yuan-ti and the other creatures have escaped into the streets of the city. And where was Aribeth during all this?
You? Did Aribeth really expect a... a whelp such as this would be able to defend the Waterdhavian creatures? Is she really so blind to the truth, Fenthick?
Desther! I will have you speak no more ill of Lady Aribeth. She did what she thought was best.
Bah! I know of the feelings you and Lady Aribeth have for each other, but it does nothing to change the facts. She was wrong to bring the creatures here.
I will leave you and your lady love to clean up this mess, Fenthick. I must go and make arrangements to recover the cure Aribeth has so carelessly lost.
We came too late! The creatures are lost, the Academy students slain... NO! This cannot be! How could this happen?
Yes, I am <FirstName>.
You right. Me name be <FirstName>.
Aribeth? Have you spoken to her recently?
Aribeth? When you speak at her?
Is the battle over then?
Do you know who attacked the Academy?
So what happens now?
Fight over now?
You find out who bad guys be?
What we do now?
I will help you in this task, Fenthick.
Would there be some type of reward for recovering the missing creatures?
Aribeth promised me a reward earlier. I'm still waiting for it.
I suppose my work here is done. I'll be going now.
Me want help you, Fenthick.
You gonna give lots gold if me get monsters back?
Aribeth already promise me reward, but me not get it yet.
Me guess me done here. Me go now.
I'm not interested.
Me not interested.
You have no right to do this!
Given the choices, I guess I'll help you.
You not got no right for do this!
Me got no choice - me help you.
I wish to ask you some questions.
Me want ask you stuff.
I will meet you at the Halls of Justice within the week then.
Me meet yous at Justice place in the week, then.
Tell me about yourself.
Tell me about Aribeth.
Tell me about Desther.
Me want know stuff 'bout you.
Me want know stuff 'bout Aribeth.
Me want know stuff 'bout Desther.
Tell me more about these Waterdhavian creatures.
Me want know more 'bout Waterdeep monsters.
So you and Aribeth are lovers?
You and Aribeth be all lovey?
I have come from Lady Aribeth. She sent me to protect the creatures.
Me come from Lady Aribeth. She send me for save creatures.
You must forgive Desther. The strain of the Wailing Death weighs heavily on the Helmites.
As their leader, Desther has worked long and hard to help ease the suffering of Neverwinter, and this most recent setback has upset him greatly.
We came too late! The creatures are lost, the Academy students slain... NO! This cannot be! How could this happen?
You are the student she sent? Did Aribeth really think a... a whelp such as this could defend the Waterdhavian creatures? She should have come herself! Is she really so blind, Fenthick?
Desther! I will have you speak no more ill of Lady Aribeth. She did what she thought was best.
Bah! I know of the feelings you and Lady Aribeth have for each other, but it does nothing to change the facts. She was wrong to bring the creatures here.
I will leave you and your lady love to clean up this mess, Fenthick. I must go and make arrangements to recover the cure Aribeth has so carelessly lost.
I am Fenthick Moss, priest of Tyr and companion of the Lady Aribeth. You must be <FirstName>, the student Aribeth told me about.
Desther and I arrived with reinforcements shortly after the attack began. We found Aribeth in the south assembly chamber, hard pressed by dozens of the mysterious assailants.
We managed to drive off the attackers and Aribeth told us she had sent one of the students on ahead to defend the Waterdhavian creatures.

While Aribeth tended to the wounded, one of the mages who had arrived with the reinforcements teleported Desther and me to this room. Alas, we arrived to find the cages upturned, the creatures fleeing.
A few straggling goblins are all that remain of our attackers, but I fear we have lost this battle. The Waterdhavian creatures are gone.
We have no clues as to who planned the attack, and I doubt any prisoners we take will know anything about who is truly behind this.
In any case, discovering their identity is secondary. Our first priority must be to recapture the Waterdhavian creatures so that we may extract a cure for the Wailing Death.
We have no clues as to who planned the attack, and I doubt any prisoners we take will know anything about who is truly behind this.
A few straggling goblins are all that remain of our attackers, but I fear we have lost this battle. The Waterdhavian creatures are gone.
I would like to think whoever helps in this task does so out of a selfless desire to end the misery of the plague, <FirstName>.
However, I have no doubt that there will be both gold and glory for those who recover the Waterdhavian creatures.
I have no doubt Aribeth's offer was sincere, but the creatures are gone, <FirstName>. You cannot expect a reward for *failing*.
Understand that I am not trying to lay blame; that will not change what has happened. But now we must focus our efforts on recovering the cure.
Neverwinter needs you, <FirstName>, now more than ever. The plague has taken many good men and women, and this attack has cost the lives of even more.
We need all the help we can get if the cure for the Wailing Death is to be recovered. In the coming week we will rally what resources we can and reconvene in the Hall of Justice.
I didn't want it to come to this, <FirstName>, but if necessary I will conscript you into Neverwinter's service for the good of the city.
