You can't talk to him, though. I heard he got put in his place by someone. Nothing happening in the district now.
Maybe me gonna do that! You gives gold or you die!
Perhaps I will! Give me all your gold or die!
Me collecting tax to help me keep streets safe.
I'm collecting a tax to help me keep the streets free of crime.
Me just leave nows. Sorry to bothers.
I'll just leave. Sorry to bother you.
Maybe me just go back to other questions.
Perhaps I should just go back to my other questions.
You not understand. If me not get paid, you not safe. Me make sure you not safe!
You don't understand. If I don't get paid, you won't be safe. I'll see to it!
I... I can't fight you. Take what I have and go. Just go.
Don't... don't let me see you here again... please.
I'm sorry to disappoint you, but if you are here to rob me you are too late. I've nothing left. If you have other business, state it and get out.
I'm not interested in donating today, thank you.
Very well. I'm not sure what you were getting at, but I'm glad you are leaving.
Very well... but make it quick. I'm not sure what you are up to...
Ah, I see. Well, it appears I have very little choice. Take what you must. Just get the hell out afterward.
Hold on. If you are trying to find out if I have gold to steal, the answer is no, I don't. Someone beat you to it, so state whatever other business you have and get out.
There was something about a woman named Formosa, but whatever business she had seems to be concluded. This district is quite quiet now.
If it's all the same, I don't want to spend much time in your... charming presense. Besides, Meldanen is a fearsome man. Myself, I wouldn't mind if he turned up dead one day.
Ooh, aren't you a charmer. I suppose there's no harm in a friendly... chat. Well... word is that Meldanen recently accquired a young woman for his amusement.
No, not really. There was some trouble with a mage named Meldanen, but that is long over with. This district is pretty quiet now.
Meldanen done with. Yous can go nows.
Meldanen has been taken care of. You can get out of here now.
<StartCheck>[Flirt]</Start> Yous can tell me, okay, handsome guy?
<StartCheck>[Flirt]</Start> Come now, handsome. You can tell little old me.
Forgive me, lass, but I don't find your... interest... all that appealing. Let's discuss something else, hmm?
Ahh, it's not worth worrying about. He's been taken care of, I hear. He was the main problem in Blacklake, as far as I'm concerned. It's pretty quiet now.
Are there a lot of other guards? Could they get here if I attacked you?
Is there lots of other guards in heres? Could they gets here if me attacked you?
So you'd realize you are at my mercy! Give me all your gold!
Just so's you can't gets help! Give me all yous gold!
No reason. Back to my other questions.
Eh, no reasons. Back to other questions, okay?
Nevermind. Farewell for now.
Nothing. Bye for nows.
I guess there was some commotion at the Seedy Tavern or something, but it's all quiet here now. Nothing going on except the plague slowly killing us all.
Uh, there... there aren't a lot around, no. W-why do you ask?
Oh no, I know where this is going. Look, I've got no gold left, so you might as well forget about threatening me. Just ask your questions and get out.
What?! No, please! Here, take what I have, just leave me in peace... I just want to get out of this whole mess alive... that's all I want...
Get out... get out of my sight... please...
If you don't care, you won't mind handing over all your gold!
If yous not care, then you not mind giving all yous gold!
Give me your gold or I'll kill you. I'm a guard. I'll easily get away with it.
Yeah, me kill you easy, so you be safe and pay me not to.
You are right, of course. I apologize.
You right. Me sorry.
If you are just waiting to die, no one will miss you if I kill you for your gold.
If yous just waiting to die, nobody miss you if me kills you for gold!
That isn't my problem. You pay or you die. It's simple!
What me care about that? You pays or yous dies! Easy!
All right, all right, let's just go back to my questions.
Okay, okay, we just go over my questions then.
I maybe heard of something happening at the Jim Seedy's tavern, but it's all over now. Nothing much going on in the Docks now, except the plague, I guess.
You aren't serious... are you? Please, I have so little left. How will I by food? How will I survive?
You are wasting your breath. You can threaten all you want, but I have nothing left to give. Someone else beat you to it.
No! Please... I'll give you what I have... please just get out... leave me... with nothing... (sob!)
So, with that bit of unpleasantness out of the way, did you have questions, or are you going to leave my home?
Okay, then. I'm not sure what you want here, but if you have something to say, do so and get out.
Please! T-that may be true, but I've no gold left to give! You aren't the first evil creature to break into my home... I have nothing left to give. Nothing!
W-what? Please, no! I have so little... how will I eat? It is so hard to get by with the plague and all the trouble around here.
I can't do anything to stop you from killing me. I can only ask that you ask your questions and please leave. The plague will get us all eventually anyway.
Please, say what you must and get out.
Please! I... I'll give what I have, but it isn't much. Times are so hard... please just take it and go... I can't believe you are so cruel...
Just get out...
So you have absolutely nothing left at all?
So yous gots nothing left at all? Nothings?
Ah-HA! If you can buy a shirt, you've got gold! Give it to me!
Ah-HA! So you gots gold to buy shirts! You gives it to me!
I won't kill you. I'll say you killed your family. You'll rot in prison for their murders!
Me not kill you. Me just say you killed you's family. You gonna rot in jail for murders!
I'm sorry. I lost my head for a moment. I apologize.
Me sorry, me gots crazy for a bit. Me sorry.
Nothing. Nothing at all.
Well... I guess I have the shirt on my back, but I should probably burn that too. I'll have to buy another at the Twenty in a Quiver, I suppose.
W-what?! Is that all you want? Filthy thief! No! I say no! What are you going to do, kill me? So what! I've got nothing to live for anyway! Go ahead!
Whatever. Look, why don't you just leave me alone. I don't really want to talk to anyone right now.
You... you monster! I'd never be able to prove I didn't do it, not with a guard like you saying I did. No one would let me mourn... no one would look at me the same again...
Take it, you evil, evil piece of <race> waste. Leave me to my ashes... LEAVE ME!!
Get away from me, you evil sack of filth! Get away from my ashes!
Nothing. My last gold was stolen by some evil sack of filth. They threatened to accuse me of murdering my family... all for a few coins! Filth. FILTH!
There is no need. The pirates have been put down, the prize, the cockatrice, returned to where it needs to be. There is little in the Docks for you. It's a quiet place now.
Dangerous? No longer. The pirates are gone, and the prize, the cockatrice, is back where it needs to be. There is little to do here now. the Docks are quiet.
It is gone from here. The pirates are defeated and the prize, the cockatrice, is back in the proper hands. The Docks are done and quiet.
Goodbye.
Maybe yous can take me down the stream?
Can you take me downstream?
Okay, you send me down the stream.
Send me downstream.
Where these water-duck cave things go?
Where do these Aqueducts go?
You see anyone else come here? Anyone pass by yous?
Has anyone else passed by this point?
You look like you belong down here. It will be nice to have a new best friend. The sewers get lonely. Aqueducts! I meant Aqueducts!
There are more people in the sewers than there is sewage these days. Er... not that these are the sewers. No sir! Aqueducts! Pure and clean!
Well, hello your Majesty! I sure as shucks don't see personry of your distinction down here much. Come to inspect the sewers... Aqueducts! I meant Aqueducts!
Please pardon my confusion. I'm still getting the hang of this new beautification program the city council put in place. The finer points of it seem to be giving things pretty names.
You know: sewers become aqueducts, waste becomes surplus resource, and my cushy job at the castle becomes tour-guide to the FREAKIN' SEWERS! BUT I'M NOT BITTER!
You sure you won't stick around? I found some hors d'oeuvres. I think they're little wieners. Uh... okay, bye then.
Well, I can't leave my post here. An emergency might arise and my special expertise might be needed. IT COULD HAPPEN!
I can send you down on your own. It ain't dangerous. Leastwise, I don't think so. Just say the word and you're good to go.
Yes <sir/madam>, merrily merrily! Here you go.
Well, they join up with the older sewers a ways down. There used to be some old storerooms back in there, but they ain't been used by the city for years and years.
As the districts expanded, access to those old areas got built over. Not a lot of people know the layout of those old tunnels. I hear voices down there on occasion, though.
Well now, actually there were a couple groups that I saw heading downstream. I thought it was a bit odd, but they didn't bother me.
The first was just one man on his own. Older gent, and dressed in quite the finery. He looked like he knew where he was going.
After him was a rough lot, and they looked like they had blood on their minds. Seemed a bit unsure where they were going, though.
You're back again? Some people just can't get enough of the sewers. Aqueducts! I meant Aqueducts! Nothing sewer-ish about it! No <sir/madam>!
Boat's all ready, by and by. Shining and new. Ready for anything... (sigh) Ohhh, I've wasted my life.
I guess things will be getting back to normal. Just me and the sewers. Aqueducts! I meant to say Aqueducts! Pure and clean! Yes indeed!
Ugh, get on with you, you're spoiling my view.
Whoa! I've seen better looking faces on busted clocks!
You know you're hideously ugly, right? Did you know night was dark and water is wet? Seems just as obvious to me.
I don't know what kind of reaction you're hoping for. If you're something special, I ain't heard about it.
Unless you're a nymph with a mug, I'm not interested in talking.
Sorry, friend, I'm not in the mood to talk.
You sure you're in the right place. You look a little above the customers we usually get in here.
You aren't royalty, are you? Pretty dangerous for you in the docks if you are. Pretty tempting target.
No offence meant, but why are you slumming here? You look like Blacklake, through and through.
I apologize. Had I known I would be seeing such a vision as you I would have spruced myself up a bit. Ahh, like it would help. (burp)
I don't usually see women of your ample gifts in this place. It's pretty rough.
Well, aren't you a pretty lass.
Oh hello. Uh... some of my best friends are <race>. Yeah.
I didn't come to this tavern to sit with you <race> types. Skitter off, will you?
Now, I don't have a problem with you <race> types personally, but... no, really, I don't.
You sticking around town after this plague business is over? People are friendlier to us <race> types when they ain't so tense about dying.
Been a while since I seen someone <race> I didn't know. Safe travels, friend.
Hello there, <race> kin. Watch yourself. Some people here ain't that friendly to us.
Ahh, barbarian types always make the day more interesting. Can I dare you to eat stuff?
You behave yourself in here, barbarian. This is a respectable place... most days.
I don't want any trouble, barbarian.
Go away, spellchucker. I'm not in the mood to talk to strangers.
I don't trust spellcasters. You people fiddle with some strange stuff.
Can't you whistle up some magic to make this plague go away, spellcaster?
I'm done praying for the plague to end, cleric. It ain't worked yet.
Have you words of wisdom for these dark times, cleric?
I got no time for you, cleric. I like my demons just fine.
I hope you aren't looking for trouble. Put that weapon away.
You'd better mean business if you are going to walk around armed like that.
Don't go waving that weapon at me, friend.
Plague will take you all the easier if you are weak from combat. Get yourself looked at.
You'll bleed your life out if you don't get those wounds looked at.
Gods, get yourself healed up, fool!
I don't need to see your bare necessities, thank you. I just ain't in the mood for that crap.
Whoa, you should go to the Moonstone Mask if you are going to prance around with your unmentionables hanging out.
Get some clothes on, fool. This ain't that kind of tavern!
Me gots to talk at you abouts gold.
I need to talk to you about gold.
Me just going to leave. Nevermind.
Actually, I'm just going to leave now.
That okay, we just go back to other questions, okay?
Forget it. Let's just go back to my other questions.
Just little bit of gold, 50 maybe, stops accidents from happening. REAL SOON!
As little as 50 gold can prevent accidents in the home. YOUR home.
Golds will protect yous from me. That good value. Pay or die!
Gold will protect you from me. A valuable service. Pay or die!
About... gold? W-what do you want to say?
Are you... threatening me? But... but you're a guard... aren't you? Aren't you supposed to protect people like me?
Wait! Please, don't hurt me! I've worked so hard to survive this long! Just... okay, take it... take it all. It's not worth it...
Get out... leave me... you have everything of mine... just go.
I have an answer for you before you say another word. I have none. I have already been robbed blind, thank you very much. Have you any other questions, or will you be leaving now?
Get away from me! You are evil, evil filth!
How good is security in the district?
How good is guards and stuff around here?
Because I would like to offer you protection. You never know when evil will strike.
'Cause me wants to give protection. Yous never can tell when evil gonna happen.
Actually, I'll just go back to my other questions.
Me just go back to other questions, okay?
I think that would be safest. You want to be safe, don't you?
That probably safest. Yous wants to be safe, don't yous?
You again?! Haven't you done enough! Get out!
The last person to ask me that robbed me blind. If this is a roundabout way of threatening me, don't waste your time. I've nothing to give you.
It's... pretty poor right now. That should be obvious, given the circumstances. W-what are you getting at? Why are you asking?
What do you mean? Are you... are you threatening me? Are you trying to get me to pay so you leave me alone?
Y-yes, I suppose I do... take it then... and get out of here... I don't want to see your face again... please...
Ugh... I'm sorry... give me a moment. The smell of the burning corpses is getting to me... As if the plague isn't bad enough on it's own. And now the Beggar's Nest is even worse! Have you heard?
I'm sorry, I prefer not to speak while this close to the burning pile. The smell is almost overpowering. Speak to my commander if you need information.
Yous really not gonna do nothing if me go in?
You really won't do anything if I go in?
Why it not be safe?
Why isn't it safe?
Maybe me go back to other stuff me ask yous
Let's go back to my other questions.
The door has already been opened anyway. You could just walk in if you wanted. I wouldn't do it, though. It's not safe.
I told you, I'm no guard. I don't make enough gold to get in your way. I say it ain't safe, but what you do is your business.
The guards inside are real tough. I'm not sure why Hodge didn't put them out here. Maybe he wants them as a surprise for burglars. I don't know.
They attack on sight. Nothing more than killers, really. Working as a guard just lets them hurt people legally. I don't like them much.
Sorry, but I can't help you there. Anything else you need?
So now I'm standing out here, pretending that I'm threatening. I don't even think I'm getting paid more for this.
Those nobles in the Blacklake; one of them was hoarding food! I had heard they had a cure, but it was just plain old greed!
Did you have something to do with the prison break in he Peninsula? Sorry, I didn't mean it like that. You look rough, I guess, but you might have helped stop it, right?
Those nobles in the Blacklake; one of them was hoarding food! I had heard they had a cure, but it was just plain old greed!
You know the rumors I heard about the prison break? They were true! At least, that's what I hear. I guess it was pretty bad in the Peninsula, but it's quiet now.
Are you one fo the new militia recruits? Maybe you had something to do with clearing the zombies out of the Beggar's Nest? Good on you if you did.
Was that you that took care of the prison break in the Peninsula? I heard it was one of the new recruits, but I didn't get any names. Thanks if it was.
Are you one fo the new militia recruits? Maybe you had something to do with clearing the zombies out of the Beggar's Nest? Good on you if you did.
Those nobles in the Blacklake; one of them was hoarding food! I had heard they had a cure, but it was just plain old greed!
Those nobles in the Blacklake; one of them was hoarding food! I had heard they had a cure, but it was just plain old greed!
I guess I should apologize to the city militia. I heard the Peninsula was out of control, but now everything is back to normal there. Well, normal plus plague.
I heard one fo the militia went to the Blacklake and told those nobles to smarten' up! Still no cure, but at least they are catching hell, too.
Id' stay in the core, if I were you. I mean, sure, there's no more zombies in the Beggar's Nest, but the plague will get you just the same.
You brute. I'd tell you to go to the Docks with all the other ruffians, but I heard a militia recruit cleaned it all up! I hear a lot of stuff, though.
There was a prison break in the Peninsula, but it's over now. I heard it was a new militia recruit that took care of it. Don't know for sure.
At least the Docks have calmed down a bit. I heard there were thieves everywhere, but one of the guards went in there and took care of it.
First I heard that the nobles in Blacklake had a cure, now I hear they don't. Can't you make your god make things clearer?
I suppose you're going to claim your god had something to do with the zombies leaving the Beggar's Nest? Cure the plague, then we'll talk.
There were rumors about a cure in the Blacklake, but I guess it isn't true. I wish it was, even if they weren't going to share.
At least the Beggar's Nest is clear of zombies now. Of course, the number plague-dead could still bury us all.
Those nobles were up to something in the Blacklake, but not any more. Rumors were they had a plague cure. I guess not...
I had heard the nobles in the Blacklake had a cure, but I guess it was all bluster and rumor. One of the new recruits put them in their place.
I heard there were lots of people dead after the prison break in the Peninsula. Glad it's over. The plague kills enough of us.
I heard a new recruit took care of the zombies in the Beggar's Nest. I hope we don't burn the corpses in the Core, though. It smells bad enough now...
I heard there were lots of people dead after the prison break in the Peninsula. Glad it's over. The plague kills enough of us.
You one of the new city guard? I heard someone new took care of the zombies in the Beggar's Nest. Good job, whoever it was.
Those nobles were up to something in the Blacklake, but not any more. Rumors were they had a plague cure. I guess not... we're still burning our dead.
Them nobles tried some fancy shenanigans in the Blacklake, but one of the militia put them in their place! Serves them right!
I heard pirates made a move on the Docks district, but they got put down by a new militia recruit. How humbling is that, huh?
The nobles in the Blacklake have been put in their place, I hear. I hope, anyway. They're too full of themselves at the best of times.
Corpses were walking the Beggar's Nest! They've been stopped, now, but who knows what's coming next!
You're obviously a thug of some sort. You missed your shot, though. I hear the criminals in the Docks are on the run now.
I heard the prison break in the Peninsula district was put down violently. I hope the bodies don't get burned here. There's too many now.
I heard the Docks district is quieter now. Maybe I should go there. I really need to get away from the smell of burning flesh.
Did you take your teachings to the Blacklake, holy <man/woman>? Is that why I hear their hoarding is over?
I suppose you and your god will be taking credit for the zombies in the Beggar's Nest being destroyed? Stop the plague, then I'll listen.
I heard the Blacklake nobles were hoarding stuff, but someone went in there and did something about it. Mostly rumor, though.
At least the zombies in the Beggar's Nest have been dealt with. Of course, their corpses probably still carry plague...
This man looks worried. He is constantly looking out across the street, obviously hoping he will see someone.
A cleaning lady working for some of the Blacklake nobles. Her plain style of dress is a stark contrast to the finery of her employers.
This man is scared out of his mind. It would be remarkable to get anything coherent out of him.
This person is clearly agitated. From his haggard appearance, it is fair to surmise that the plague has turned his life upside down.
This woman is obviously upset. From her haggard appearance, it is fair to surmise that the plague has turned her life upside down.
This is one of Neverwinter's many fine purveyors of spirits. He is dressed plainly, wanting to appear friendly and unassuming to his customers.
This young dwarf looks nervous and uncertain. He's seen too much death recently, and apparently far too much undeath as well.
This undead creature looks formidable, but there's something in the way it acts that suggests inexperience, and perhaps more talk than sense.
This half-elf militia guard looks like he has seen better days. His captor has not been gentle.
Desther shifts uncomfortably, obviously displeased with those around him. He looks preoccupied and strained, as though wanting more control over the situation than he has.
This man looks supremely confident, like he is used to commanding during a crisis. He's a seasoned veteran of the battlefield.
Still wearing the tatters of his prison uniform, this escaped prisoner has the vicious look of someone with nothing to lose.
This is an elven member of the city militia, his face showing the strain that he and his fellow guards suffer in these troubled times.
This Halfling appears totally in control of himself and the situation around him. He acts like a leader, and the people around him act accordingly.
This man glares angrily, ready to lash out at least verbally. He looks utterly frustrated with his predicament. His armor bears the symbol of Cyric.
One of the city militia, this man's face shows the strain of long hours dealing with the effects of the plague.
A proud looking ruffian in a red and blue uniform, obviously a member of a mercenary company or a highly organized group of bandits.
This man's robes proudly display the symbol of Helm. He meets your gaze with suspicion, at first, but then offers a friendly smile.
This woman returns your gaze with a cold glance, dismissing you utterly. She appears to be in no mood for conversation.
This is a fast-talking auctioneer, looking very annoyed that the evening has apparently not gone as planned.
This woman smiles politely, but pats her sword while she does it.
This is the traitorous lieutenant of Vengaul Bloodsail, looking absolutely incensed that his plan has not gone as smooth as it was supposed to.
A large man, obviously watching the door behind him, but he doesn't really look like a properly trained guard.
This man is keeping to himself, but appears to be observing the room very closely. He's being carefully watched by the half-orc next to him.
This elven woman looks defiant, despite having been harassed by her captors. She's wearing a Bloodsailor uniform, but doesn't look like much of a fighter.
This amiable gnome seems oblivious to his poverty. He is bright-eyed amidst the gloom of the plague. Certainly he must be mad.
Gilda is an older, friendly serving wench trying to keep customers in the Golden Apple happy, despite the turmoil outside.
A noble, trying to maintain his dignity, but clearly out of his element. He looks lost, as though not sure what to do next.
A jovial half-orc in a Bloodsailor uniform. He's keeping a close eye on the man next to him... and drinking a heroic amount of ale.
This merchant looks secure and content, like the plague has not affected his business. Perhaps he sells to a clientele that can't go anywhere else.
A dignified butler, looking not at all pleased about being in the Docks.
This man looks accustomed to rough living. He scans the area nervously, person to person, looking close at what they are wearing and carrying.
This man looks haggard and ready to fight. He's obviously not friendly.
A Bloodsailor traitor that now follows Callik, although he looks a bit nervous, as though he was told this would all go a lot smoother.
A wiry old swashbuckler dressed in flashy, well-kept garments. A scoundrel that likes to twirl his moustache whilst dueling with deserving and respected rivals.
This man looks to be about two drinks away from being flat on his back.
This elf returns your gaze intently. He is almost out of place amidst the city backdrop, his manner suggesting a very personal connection to nature.
Lydia
Harris
Jerome
Maureen
Saulter
Bethany
Lady Aribeth is the epitome of grace and concentration, although she is obviously preoccupied with worry for those suffering from the plague.
This man looks serious and composed, his armor impeccably maintained. He obviously regards his duties as being of the utmost importance.
Fenthick looks concerned for those suffering, obviously willing to do anything if it would help the situation. His face looks weary, but hopeful.
This elf has been run off her feet caring for the endless number of plague victims that pass though here. She looks very tired.
A common man of Neverwinter, this person wears simple clothes and the harried look of someone living in the shadow of plague.
Elves are possessed of extraordinary beauty and grace, but the misery of the Wailing has given this woman a deeply sad expression.
This elf of Neverwinter carries himself proudly, although concern about the plague weighs in his eyes, like it does for everyone else.
Still wearing the tatters of his prison uniform, this escaped dwarf has the vicious look of someone with nothing to lose.
Still wearing the tatters of his prison uniform, this escaped half-orc has the vicious look of someone with nothing to lose.
A smartly dressed and ordered militia captain. He shares the weary look of those under him, however. The plague is a strain on everyone.
A simple barmaid, looking a bit tired from the strain of continuing to serve customers while the world apparently ends outside.
A thoroughly repugnant creature, the Waterdhavian Intellect Devourer radiates evil. You cannot read its strange features, but only a fool would think it friendly.
This woman appears aware of everything around her, thriving amidst the chaos. She doesn't have the tired look her militia companions suffer from.
A privately hired guard, this elf regards you coldly. He appears quite capable of defending himself, if need be.
A privately hired guard, which are usually valued for their viciousness. He regards you coldly. He appears quite capable of defending himself, if need be.
A privately hired guard, which are usually valued for their viciousness. She regards you coldly, appearing quite capable of defending herself, if need be.
Despite being caged for a number of days, this Waterdhavian creature is still eerily beautiful. She looks sad, however, and more than a little weak.
His clothing crisp and spotless, this elf scans the room nervously. He appears terribly preoccupied, his manner suggesting that he is greatly troubled.
An utterly despondent man, he looks as though he has lost everything in the world. Given the state of the city, he just may have.
A proud looking woman in a red and blue uniform, obviously a member of a mercenary company or a highly organized group of bandits.
A ragged looking elf in a red and blue uniform, obviously a member of a mercenary company or a highly organized group of bandits.
One of the few people not affected by the plague. Well, at least not physically affected. This person looks a bit... unsteady.
Charon
The Waterdhavian Cockatrice looks understandably skittish, given the chaotic happenings of the last few weeks. It is small, but threatened animals are doubly dangerous.
This dwarf looks exceptionally friendly.
A half-orc militia member. Stronger than many of his companions, dealing with the horrors of the plague have left him looking just as weary.
This halfling stares back at you with accusing eyes, obviously not trusting a soul a single step more than he has to.
This man looks exceptionally strong, but his manner is childlike and simple. He looks like he doesn't know what he should be doing.
A practical looking halfling, rolling her eyes at the absurdity of her situation.
This young man looks very worried and does not appear to have slept for the last day or so.
An animated suit of armor, obviously echanted by powerful magics.
The Waterdhavian Yuan-Ti appears cold and reptilian, appropriately enough. She looks well armored and armed, not at all friendly, and determined not to be captured.
This corpse has somehow been animated, but not actually restored to life. It wanders mindlessly, drawn to attack the living.
This woman appears calm and immensely sure of herself. Her clothes are impeccable, as though they repel the very dust in the air.
A powerful example of his kind, this half-orc appears ready for battle... any battle.
A large man obviously used to fighting. He's ready to fight and does not look like he plans on holding back.
A remarkably calm individual, this halfling gives no outward indication of what he might be thinking.
This woman is enthralled by combat, showing obvious admiration for anyone who can prove competent in the pit.
This dwarf eyes you cautiously. He appears sturdy and well groomed, his beard impeccably maintained.
This woman carries the tools of a healer with her, though from the look of her scars, she has seen a goodly number of battles herself.
Briley is a young dwarf, and looks earnest but inexperienced. He proudly wears the symbols of Tyr, the Even-Handed.
This woman looks nervous. Perhaps it is just the plague, but she keeps glancing around her home in an odd manner.
This man eyes the room carefully, making note of each person present. His cold manner is in stark contrast to the other clientele.
This gnome is visibly shaking, obviously terrified that you might hurt him.
This woman looks at you immodestly. She winks and makes an obscene gesture.
This halfling looks very tense and controlling. He does not look like the type to tolerate visitors in his kitchen.
A thoroughly unpleasant looking creature, his very manner suggests bully to the core.
This woman looks at you immodestly with reassuring eyes. She has an honest face.
This woman appears extremely confident. She watches everything with a knowing eye -- nothing escapes her notice.
This man looks about the room impassively, patiently waiting for his next customer.
This noble looks a blustery sort, used to getting his own way.
The construct stares straight ahead, waiting for some predetermined condition to set it in motion. It looks frighteningly strong and battle-ready.
This halfling male is enthralled by combat, showing obvious admiration for anyone brave enough to prove competent in the pit.
An indignant noble, he is a man used to getting his way no matter the cost or obstacles.
Obviously hostile, this elf looks like a spellcaster. He is well equipped, suggesting that he is a mercenary or an adventurer, and likely dangerous.
This man looks well equipped and ready to fight. He doesn't have a uniform, so he's either a mercenary or an adventurer, and likely dangerous.
This woman belongs to Neverwinter's lower middle-class. Her clothes are simple, but dignified. Her manner is understandably downtrodden, given that death is all around.
This man is ignoring the room, seeming more intent on drinking than on paying attention to what he probably thinks is none of his business.
This man is slowly dying, his body rotting away from the Wailing Death plague. No doubt it will have affected his mind as well.
This wandering spirit is obviously distraught. Such phantoms are often unable to rest until the matters of their lives are settled.
Peninsula: Prison Break

There's been a prison break in the Peninsula District. Gate Captain Kipp recommends talking to Sedos Sebile to determine the best means of getting into the Prison and helping out. She's headquartered in the district's southeast corner.

There has been a prison break in the Peninsula District. Aside from the chaos in the district, itself, former prisoners now patrol the prison interior while the former guards beg for rescue from the prison cells.
On his release, a former cell block captain confirmed that the Head Gaoler, in an unexplained fit of madness, was somehow responsible for the prison break. The Head Gaoler apparently remains in the bowels of the Prison, controlling events with an unseen hand and toward an unknown purpose.

There has been a prison break in the Peninsula District. Aside from the chaos in the district, itself, former prisoners now patrol the prison interior, killing off the former guards within their cells. Emernik, a former guard on the second floor, has so far managed to dodge the fate of his fellows and was able to shed further light on the goings-on within the complex.
Apparently the Head Gaoler has been conducting some form of experiment on the former guards, torturing them and attempting to somehow influence their minds. Emernik and the guards dead in their cells appear to be the failed subjects of the experiment. What has become of those who succeeded remains unknown.

There has been a prison break in the Peninsula District. Aside from the chaos in the district, itself, former prisoners now patrol the prison interior, killing off the former guards within their cells.
The dreaded Pits sprawl out beneath the Prison's second floor. At one time, this was where the guards threw the most unruly of their prisoners. Now those prisoners have seized it for their own and it is the guards who have been thrown out... All except one - the Head Gaoler.

There has been a prison break in the Peninsula District. Aside from the chaos in the district, itself, former prisoners now patrol the prison interior, killing off the former guards within their cells.
The dreaded Pits sprawl out beneath the Prison's second floor. At one time, this was where the guards threw the most unruly of their prisoners. Now those prisoners have seized it for their own and it is the guards who have been thrown out.
Kurdan Fenkt, the self-proclaimed 'King of the Pits' and second-in-command to the dreaded Head Gaoler has surrendered and told quite a tale... Apparently the Head Gaoler is already long dead, his corpse little more than the walking host of a strange, dog-like creature that lives inside his head, feeding on his brain.
The lair of this strange beast is on the Prison's fourth and final floor. According to Fenkt, the creature protects itself with a small army of former guards, their minds dominated by the creature's power. There is a chance they may be freed but the larger goal of destroying the creature must take priority.

With the death of the strange creature that had consumed the Head Gaoler's once-noble mind, the Peninsula District has been returned to safety, at least from this immediate threat. The Wailing Death still hangs heavily over the place, however.
The brain of the creature has been salvaged and word of it should taken to local authorites. Sedos Sebile, the ranking officer in the area, will likely offer substantial 'danger pay' for the completion of the task.

Upon being told of the strange creature, Sedos Sebile declared it to be that of an Intellect Devourer, one of the missing creatures sent as part of the plague-cure.
It should be delivered to Lady Aribeth with the greatest of haste, as she would no doubt be happy to learn of its recovery.
There's been a prison break in the Peninsula District.
Peninsula: The Tanglebrook Estate

A tunnel beneath the Tanglebrook Estate is reputed to provide access into the Prison. The estate lies along the northern shore of the Peninsula, facing the sea, and Lady Tanglebrook apparently keeps a spare key hidden beneath her doormat.
A key has been found to the Tanglebrook Estate in the Peninsula District. The estate lies on the north shore of the Peninsula, with a nice view of the sea.
A key to the Tanglebrook Estate has been discovered. The estate rests along the north shore of the Peninsula and is said to have tunnel access into the Prison.

Lady Tanglebrook has been found dead, in a pool of her own blood, within the oppressing gloom of her Peninsula District tunnels. The menacing statues of an unfinished chess game loomed about her in the dark, silent witnesses to whatever transpired there.
It was no ordinary crime, that is sure. Even in the threadbare light, one could see that her skull had been shattered and the brain either eaten or removed. Whatever killed her, it wasn't the Wailing Death. Maybe that is reason enough to be thankful. Then again, maybe not... The door into the Prison is not far off.

Lady Tanglebrook's tunnel, for all its horrors and oppressive gloom, does indeed offer a route into the dreaded Prison. It opens into a small antechamber just off the former offices of the Head Gaoler.
Peninsula: The Prison Key

Sedos Sebile, Commander of militia operations in the Peninsula, has requested help in finding a means into the Prison. She believes that a key to the Prison's main door might be held by escapees hiding in the sewers in the southwest of the district.
A key to the Prison's main entrance has been found on one of the Escaped Prisoners.
The main door to the Prison in the Peninsula District has been unlocked.
Temple of Tyr: Never's Tomb

Judge Oleff of the Hall of Justice seeks the tomb of Neverwinter's founder, Lord Halueth Never, in the hopes that it might buoy the people's spirits and perhaps unearth some artifacts that might be of assistance against the Wailing.
He has requested that those interested in the endeavor present themselves to his assistant, Briley, who currently stands guard over the recently discovered tomb of Miaslaznia Fairblade, one of Halueth's adventuring companions. Miaslaznia's tomb can be reached via the cellars of a house on the east side of the Peninsula District.

Judge Oleff of the Hall of Justice seeks the tomb of Neverwinter's founder, Lord Halueth Never, in the hopes that it might buoy the people's spirits and perhaps unearth some artifacts that might be of assistance against the Wailing.
His assistant, Briley, waits by the recently discovered tomb of Miaslaznia Fairblade, one of Halueth's adventuring companions, and tells a sad tale indeed - like so many others in the city, the entire excavation team responsible for the discovery has passed away of the Wailing Death. The only known documentation of their discovery is a journal left by one of the team members. Briley has secured it in a chest outside of Miaslaznia's tomb and has encouraged interested parties to examine it in the hopes of deciphering the possible location of other tombs. Miaslaznia's tomb can be reached via the cellars of a house on the east side of the Peninsula District.

One of the artifacts from Lord Never's tomb has been returned to Judge Oleff at the Hall of Justice. According to the excavator's journal found in one of the early tombs, another two artifacts are believed to be still undiscovered.

Two of the artifacts from Lord Never's tomb have been returned to Judge Oleff at the Hall of Justice. According to the excavator's journal found in one of the early tombs, only one remains undiscovered.

Three of the artifacts from Lord Never's tomb have been returned to Judge Oleff at the Hall of Justice. According to the excavator's journal found in one of the early tombs, one more artifact still remains to be discovered.

All three artifacts from Lord Never's tomb have been returned to Judge Oleff at the Hall of Justice. They should be of great assistance in bouying the spirits of the plague-struck city and may prove to be of some practical benefit as well.
NEWS: Prison Break in the Peninsula District
Adventurers have entered the Peninsula District in an effort to quell the prison riot that has spilled into its streets.
In their continuing effort to resolve the Peninsula District prison riots, adventurers have recently broken into the prison itself.

The adventurers investigating the prison break in the Peninsula District have emerged victorious. According to their story, the Head Gaoler ignited the riots and imprisoned the guards formerly under his command while under the fatal influence of a strange, brain-devouring creature. The creature has been killed and the District is slowly returning to normal.
Beggar's Nest: Aldo and Hector
A family is guarding a broken-down wagon in the center of the Beggar's Nest. They will not leave until Hector has returned. Hector is out searching the Beggar's Nest looking for parts for the wagon.

Encountered Hector in the Beggar's Nest. He is trying to find parts for his master Aldo's wagon, but it is doubtful there is anything left in this looted district. He's waiting for someone to lead him back to Aldo, who is guarding the wagon with his family in the center of the district.
Hector is now being escorted back to his master, Aldo. Aldo, is guarding his broken wagon with his family in the center of the Beggar's Nest.
Encountered Hector, who was trying to find parts for his master Aldo's wagon. He's dead.
Having been told that his servant Hector is still alive, Aldo wants him led back to the wagon in the center of the Beggar's Nest.
Aldo is no longer concerned about Hector. Aldo and his family are now being escorted to safety somewhere in the Beggar's Nest.
Since it appears that his employers are dead, Hector has decided to go off on his own.
Hector has been escorted to safety.
Parts to fix the wagon could not be found, so there was no more reason for Aldo's halfling family to stay with it. They have abandoned it to try and escape the district.
Aldo and his family wanted to be led to a safe location in the Beggar's Nest, but Aldo is now dead.
Beggar's Nest: A Lost Soul
Bertrand is waiting for his brother Marcus at the Helmite shrine in the Beggar's Nest. Marcus is a mage that wears red and had certain family heirlooms.

A journal was found on a distinctive corpse in the Beggar's Nest. The man looked to be a mage that was overwhelmed by a large number of undead. The book identified him as Marcus Penhold, and mentioned that he was to meet his brother at the Helmite shrine in the southeastern corner of the district if things got too dangerous during the undead infestation.

Bertrand has been told that his brother's body was found in the Beggar's Nest. Marcus was his name, and zombies apparently overwhelmed him. None of the heirlooms he had with him have been turned in to Bertrand.

Bertrand has been told that his brother's body was found in the Beggar's Nest. Marcus was his name, and zombies apparently overwhelmed him. Some of the items Marcus had have been given to Bertrand, but not all.

Bertrand has been told that his brother's body was found in the Beggar's Nest. Marcus was his name, and zombies apparently overwhelmed him. Bertrand was most grateful for the return of all of his brother's possessions.
Bertrand is waiting at the Helmite shrine in the Beggar's Nest. He hopes that his brother arrives there soon.
Docks: Trouble in the District
The Docks District is apparently crawling with cut-throats and muggers. Their activity seems suspicious and well worth investigating.

Apparently the Seedy Tavern in the Docks District has a dirty habit of holding black market auctions. The recent rise in muggings seems to be tied to a highly-coveted piece of contraband being placed on the block. It might be a good idea to be at the tavern when it does...

Apparently the Seedy Tavern in the Docks District has a dirty habit of holding black market auctions. The recent rise in muggings seems to be tied to a highly-coveted piece of contraband being placed on the block. It might be a good idea to be at the tavern when it does...
Unfortunately, the bouncer at the door is only letting in those sporting the customary uniform of the local pirates' guild, the Bloodsailors. He openly welcomes a good bribe but only in "Smugglers' Coins," the guild's own internal currency. Failing that, maybe there's a back route instead.

The Seedy Tavern in the Docks District has a dirty habit of holding black market auctions. The recent rise in muggings seems to be tied to a highly-coveted piece of contraband being placed on the block. From the inside, the tavern definitely lives up to its name and reputation. Things are already starting to heat up, and the air is full of salt and stale sweat.

The Seedy Tavern in the Docks District has a dirty habit of holding black market auctions. The recent rise in muggings seems to be tied to a highly-coveted piece of contraband being placed on the block by Vengaul Bloodsail himself, leader of the local pirates' guild, the Bloodsailors. The auction's been mysteriously delayed, however, and from the crowds angry murmurs, it's apparent that the holdup is a result of goings on in the tavern's basement.

The Seedy Tavern in the Docks District has a dirty habit of holding black market auctions. The recent rise in muggings seems to be tied to a highly-coveted piece of contraband being placed on the block by Vengaul Bloodsail himself, leader of the local pirates' guild, the Bloodsailors. The auction's been mysteriously delayed, however, and from the crowds angry murmurs, it's apparent that the holdup is a result of goings on in the tavern's basement.
Unfortunately the door to the basement is locked and also guarded by a burly, knife-wielding chef. A password will be required to avoid his suspicions.

The Seedy Tavern in the Docks District has a dirty habit of holding black market auctions. The recent rise in muggings seems to be tied to a highly-coveted piece of contraband being placed on the block by Vengaul Bloodsail himself, leader of the local pirates' guild, the Bloodsailors. The auction's been mysteriously delayed by goings on in the tavern's basement, however.
As it turns out, the basement serves as the Bloodsailors' primary warehouse. A winding storeroom filled with various stolen and contraband goods, it's abundantly clear that people in militia employ are not going to be welcome there.

The Seedy Tavern in the Docks District has a dirty habit of holding black market auctions. The recent rise in muggings seems to be tied to a highly-coveted piece of contraband being placed on the block by Vengaul Bloodsail himself, leader of the local pirates' guild, the Bloodsailors. The auction's been mysteriously delayed by goings on in the tavern's basement, however.
As it turns out, the basement serves not only as the Bloodsailors' primary warehouse, but also as the scene of a recent split within the organization's ranks. Men loyal to Callik, second-in-command of the organization, were discovered trying to forcefully get information out of Vengaul's girlfriend regarding his whereabouts. They want the black market bounty he was to have auctioned off.
According to a note found at the scene, the item is a purported cure to the Wailing Death. Callik's men are on Vengaul's trail, apparently searching through the old Aqueducts. The note explains how to meet up with them via a magically locked gate in a maintenance building in the district's northwestern corner.

The Seedy Tavern in the Docks District has a dirty habit of holding black market auctions. The recent rise in muggings seems to be tied to a highly-coveted piece of contraband being placed on the block by Vengaul Bloodsail himself, leader of the local pirates' guild, the Bloodsailors. The auction's been mysteriously delayed by goings on in the tavern's basement, however.
As it turns out, the basement serves not only as the Bloodsailors' primary warehouse but also as the scene of a recent split within the organization's ranks. Men loyal to Callik, second-in-command of the organization, were discovered trying to force information out of Dara'nei, Vengaul's girlfriend, regarding the whereabouts of her lover and the black market bounty he was to have auctioned off.
Upon her rescue, Dara'nei claimed that Vengaul's secret auction item is actually one of the Waterdhavian creatures and that he had intended to return it to Lady Aribeth once he had first used it to ingratiate himself with his old enemy, Lord Nasher. Callik, on the other hand, is interested in nothing more than personal gain.
Vengaul apparently has some sort of escape route for himself, somewhere beneath the Silver Sails. Dara'nei's locket will allow access to the place, though only Vengaul knows what dangers are within.

The Seedy Tavern in the Docks District has a dirty habit of holding black market auctions. The recent rise in muggings seems to be tied to a highly-coveted piece of contraband being placed on the block by Vengaul Bloodsail himself, leader of the local pirates' guild, the Bloodsailors. The auction's been mysteriously delayed by goings on in the tavern's basement, however.
As it turns out, the basement serves not only as the Bloodsailors' primary warehouse but also as the scene of a recent split within the organization's ranks. Men loyal to Callik, second-in-command of the organization, were discovered trying to force information out of Dara'nei, Vengaul's girlfriend, regarding the whereabouts of her lover and the black market bounty he was to have auctioned off.
According to a note found at the scene, the item is a purported cure to the Wailing Death. Callik's men are trying to track Vengaul through the old Aqueducts at this very moment. The note explains how to meet up with them via a magically locked gate in a maintenance building in the district's northwestern corner.
Dara'nei claims that Vengaul's secret auction item is actually one of the Waterdhavian creatures and that he had intended to return it to Lady Aribeth once he had first used it to ingratiate himself with his old enemy, Lord Nasher. Callik, on the other hand, is interested in nothing more than personal gain. Vengaul apparently told Dara'nei that in times of trouble, she could find him through the Silver Sails, using her locket as a key to allow entry. He may have some sort of storehouse beneath, but only he knows what dangers are down there.

The Seedy Tavern in the Docks District has a dirty habit of holding black market auctions. The recent rise in muggings seems to be tied to a Waterdhavian creature being placed on the block by Vengaul Bloodsail himself, leader of the local pirates' guild, the Bloodsailors. The auction was delayed by internal conflict within the Bloodsailor organization, however.
A trail of evidence led to the old Aqueducts beneath the Docks District, were Vengaul and his second-in-command, Callik, are currently believed to be in a bitter quarrel for possession of the Waterdhavian creature. Traveling through the underground canals by boat, adventurers are beginning to close in on their location.

The Seedy Tavern in the Docks District has a dirty habit of holding black market auctions. The recent rise in muggings seems to be tied to a cockatrice, one of the Waterdhavian creatures, being placed on the block by Vengaul Bloodsail himself, leader of the local pirates' guild, the Bloodsailors. The auction was delayed by internal conflict within the Bloodsailor organization, however.
A trail of evidence led to the old Aqueducts beneath the Docks District, were Vengaul and his second-in-command, Callik, were engaged in a bitter quarrel for the cockatrice's possession. Traveling through the underground canals by boat, adventurers arrived in time to confiscate the creature. The trouble in the district at last resolved, all that remains is for the Waterdhavian creature to be returned to Lady Aribeth in hopes of a cure.
Docks: The Masterson Amulet

A nobleman by the name of Hemmel Masterson is huddled near the docks with his family. He gave a valuable amulet to Callik, second-in-command of the Bloodsail pirate's guild, in an arrangement whereby the Masterson family hoped to escape quarantine by ship. Callik has left them high and dry, however, opting to keep the amulet for himself.
An expensive-looking amulet has been found in the Docks District, on the body of Callik, second-in-command of the Bloodsailor pirates' guild. Etched into the back is the unfamiliar name 'Masterson.'

The party has come into possession of an expensive-looking amulet etched with the name 'Hemmel Masterson.' Hemmel is a nobleman huddled near the docks with his family. He gave the amulet to Callik, second-in-command of the Bloodsail pirate's guild, in an arrangement whereby the Masterson family hoped to escape quarantine by ship. With Callik dead, their escape now seems unlikely.
Hemmel's amulet has been returned to the Masterson family who have subsequently returned home.
NEWS: Trouble in the Docks District
Adventurers are investigating a recent outbreak of muggings in the Docks District.
Adventurers have linked the recent muggings in the Docks District to a black market auction taking place in the Seedy Tavern.
Vengaul Bloodsail, leader of the Bloodsailor pirate's guild, is harboring a Waterdhavian creature. Adventurers have tracked him to the old aqueducts beneath the Docks District.
Adventurers have retrieved a cockatrice, one of the Waterdhavian creatures, from the pirate Vengaul Bloodsail. They are returning it to Lady Aribeth.
Beggar's Nest: Missing Guard

On talking to Ergus at the main gate in the Beggar's Nest, it was learned that one of his guards has gone missing. The young man's name is Walters. Ergus doesn't know whether he fell to zombies or not.
Walters, a missing Beggar's Nest guard was found captured by the Sword Coast Boys in their warehouse. He's been told to wait where he is.
Walters, a missing Beggar's Nest guard was found captured by the Sword Coast Boys in their warehouse. Once he was freed he left to make his way back to the main district gate.
Walters, a missing Beggar's Nest guard was found captured by the Sword Coast Boys in their warehouse. He is currently being escorted back to the main gate in the district.
Walters, a Beggar's Nest guard, was rescued from the Sword Coast Boys and escorted back to the relative safety of the main gate in the district.

On talking to Ergus at the main gate in the Beggar's Nest, it was learned that one of his guards has gone missing. The young man's name is Walters, and he usually patrols the northeast of the district where he may have had some old companions. Ergus doesn't know whether he fell to zombies or not.
Walters is dead. He was a guard that had gone missing from his post in the Beggar's Nest.
Siril in Peril
Siril is a baker that lives in the Beggar's Nest, in the west, just north of the main gate. He is quite distraught, and needs an escort to safety. He has been told to remain where he is for now.
Siril is a baker that lives in the Beggar's Nest, in the west, just north of the main gate. He is quite distraught, and is currently being escorted to safety.
Siril is a baker that lives in the Beggar's Nest, in the west, just north of the main gate. He is quite distraught, and is trying to run to safety.
Siril the baker has been escorted to safety in the Beggar's Nest.
Drake has mentioned that a man named Siril may need to be rescued from the zombie infestation of the Beggar's Nest. Siril's home is in the west of the District, just north of the main gate.
Siril the baker needed to be rescued from the zombie infestation, but now he is dead.
NEWS: Undead in the Beggar's Nest
Adventurers have entered the Beggar's Nest, a district reportedly struggling under an infestation of undead. It is not known whether this new threat is related to the Wailing Death or not.

Adventurers have met with Harben Ashensmith, a key figure in the Beggar's Nest. He has asked that they investigate what is behind the infestation of undead in the district, and return to him with whatever they discover.

It is suspected that the undead infestation in the Beggar's Nest is the result of a creature infiltrating at least one local group, and using them to create a legion of zombies. Its name is Gulnan, but what it is and how it acquired its power is unknown.

Adventurers have entered the catacombs surrounding the lair of Gulnan, the creature that has caused the undead infestation in the Beggar's Nest. She is beneath the Great Graveyard, in the Warrens of the Damned.

Adventurers have killed Gulnan, the Yuan-Ti that had caused the infestation of undead in the Beggar's Nest. She was one of the Waterdhavian creatures meant to be components in a spell to cure the Wailing Death, and once Harben Ashensmith has been apprised of the situation, her heart will need to be delivered to Aribeth as soon as possible.

It is suspected that the undead infestation in the Beggar's Nest is the result of a creature infiltrating at least one local group, and using them to create a legion of zombies. Its name is Gulnan, and it may be one of the Waterdhavian creatures originally intended to help in a spell that would cure the Wailing Death. How it came to be in the Beggar's Nest and where it is getting its power is unknown.

It is suspected that the undead infestation in the Beggar's Nest is the result of a creature infiltrating at least one local group, and using them to create a legion of zombies. What it is and how it acquired its power is unknown.
Beggar's Nest: Undead Infestation

The Beggar's Nest is struggling under an infestation of Undead. It is not known if it is related to the Wailing Death or not. The man to speak to about this is Harben Ashensmith. He is in the Shining Serpent Inn, in the south central area of the Beggar's Nest district.

The Beggar's Nest needs to be explored and any information regarding who has caused the undead infestation should be reported back to Harben Ashensmith and Drake in the Shining Serpent Inn. Harben will reward people who help.

The Beggar's Nest needs to be explored and any information regarding who has caused the undead infestation should be reported back to Harben Ashensmith and Drake in the Shining Serpent Inn. Harben will reward people who help. It has been suggested that Krestal and Jemanie may have information regarding some strange local events. Krestal lives along the east central area of the district, while Jemanie lives in the west central.

The catacombs beneath the Great Graveyard have been entered, and ahead is the lair of Gulnan, the creature that apparently infiltrated and manipulated Beggar's Nest citizens to form an army of the undead.

Gulnan has been destroyed. She was a Yuan-Ti, and one of the Waterdhavian creatures imported to be part of a magical attempt to cure the Wailing Death. Her heart will need to be brought to Aribeth, and officials in the Beggar's Nest will certainly want to be told of this.

The Beggar's Nest is struggling under an infestation of Undead. It is not known if it is related to the Wailing Death or not. The man to talk to in the area is Harben Ashensmith. He is in the Shining Serpent Inn, in the south central area of the district.

Harben Ashensmith has been told of the destruction of Gulnan, the Waterdhavian Yuan-Ti that caused the undead infestation in the Beggar's Nest. Her heart is an important component in the spell that will hopefully cure the Wailing Death, and should be delivered to Lady Aribeth as soon as possible.
The Beggar's Nest is struggling under an infestation of Undead. It is not known if it is related to the Wailing Death or not.
Beggar's Nest: Find Krestal
Krestal needs to be rescued from the zombie infestation. He should also be asked whether he knows of anything to do with the cause of it. He lives in the central east of the district.
Krestal has been found.
Krestal is dead.
Beggar's Nest: Sword Coast Boys

Krestal does not know what may have caused the undead infestation, but he does know that something strange has happened to his old gang, the Sword Coast Boys. The leader of the gang, a man named Drawl, has made some sort of deal that has resulted in the gang being turned into undead. Drawl himself is some sort of powerful undead as well. The gang uses a warehouse in the north central area of the Beggar's Nest as a base of operations.

Krestal does not know what may have caused the undead infestation, but he does know that something strange has happened to his old gang, the Sword Coast Boys. The leader of the gang, a man named Drawl, has made some sort of deal that has resulted in the gang being turned into undead. Drawl himself is some sort of powerful undead now too. The gang uses a warehouse in the north central area of the Beggar's Nest as a base of operations. Krestal also mentioned mentioned Zelieph, Drawl's brother. Zelieph kept Drawl in line, but Drawl recently somehow built up the nerve to kill him.

Krestal does not know what may have caused the undead infestation, but he does know that something strange has happened to his old gang, the Sword Coast Boys. The leader of the gang, a man named Drawl, has made some sort of deal that has resulted in the gang being turned into undead. Drawl himself is some sort of powerful undead now too. The gang uses a warehouse in the north central area of the Beggar's Nest as a base of operations. Krestal also mentioned Zelieph, Drawl's brother. Zelieph kept Drawl in line, but Drawl recently somehow built up the nerve to kill him. Krestal still feels like he sees Zelieph around, like a ghost that follows him. He's stopped carrying Zelieph's ring because of it.

Walters was found in the Sword Coast Boys warehouse in the Beggar's Nest. He was captured and taunted by Drawl, the leader of the gang, because Walters used to be a member but gave it up to became a guard. Walters said that Drawl made a deal with a creature named Gulnan to become a powerful undead, and had all the other Sword Coast Boys killed to act as his undead minions. How Drawl got in contact with Gulnan, Walters doesn't know.

Walters was found in the Sword Coast Boys warehouse in the Beggar's Nest. He was captured and taunted by Drawl, the leader of the gang, because Walters used to be a member but gave it up and became a guard. Walters said that Drawl made a deal with a creature named Gulnan to become a powerful undead, and had all the other Sword Coast Boys transformed as well. Drawl cannot truly be killed while his link to Gulnan remains. He will just keep reappearing. Walters also talked about Zelieph, Drawl's brother and the only man that Drawl was truly afraid of. Drawl killed Zelieph, but Walters still feels like Zelieph is around, as though his ghost haunts the district and follows him sometimes. He's stopped carrying Zelieph's dagger because of it.

Having investigated the Sword Coast Boys, it has been revealed that the leader of the gang, Drawl, has bargained away the lives of the entire gang. He made a deal with a creature named Gulnan, and has become a powerful undead as a result. This bargain also gave him the strength to brutally murder his brother Zelieph, the man who kept Drawl in line and the only person he truly feared. Now Zelieph's spirit haunts the Beggar's Nest, and is currently being escorted to meet with his former brother, presumeably to exact revenge. Zelieph is following a former possession of his, a link to his life and a reminder of the treachery that befell him. It is not known what would happen if the spirit of Zelieph were led to his now undead brother Drawl, or what effect he would have on the link between Drawl and Gulnan.

Drawl, leader of the Sword Coast Boys, has been destroyed, and the link between him and Gulnan is severed. With Drawl out of the way, it may now be possible to find this Gulnan creature and put a stop to her plans. The warehouse likely holds some means for the two to have occasionally met. The undead infestation she has unleashed on the Beggar's Nest must be stopped.

Gulnan has corrupted other groups as well as the Sword Coast Boys. She apparently has a cult of snake worshippers under her command. They used to follow Cyric, but she deposed their old leader, and has been killing any members of the cult that do not accept her as ruler. She has created the infestation of undead using a necromantic focus that the former leader Jared created, but nobody seems to know she got powerful enough to use it or defeat him.

The path from the Sword Coast Boys warehouse has been thoroughly explored, leading to the discovery of a lair beneath. Likely it is from there, in the Warrens of the Damned, that Gulnan is creating and guiding her army of undead. The infestation she has unleashed on the Beggar's Nest must be stopped.

Gulnan has corrupted other groups as well as the Sword Coast Boys. She apparently has a cult of snake worshippers under her command. They used to follow Cyric, but she deposed their old leader, and has been killing any members of the cult that do not accept her as ruler.
Beggar's Nest: Find Jemanie

Jemanie needs to be rescued from the zombie infestation. He should also be asked whether he knows of anything to do with the cause of it. He lives in the central west of the district, north of the main gate.
Jemanie has been found.
Jemanie is dead.
Beggar's Nest: A Missing Brother

Jemanie is worried about his brother, Torin. He has been missing for several days now, and Jemanie fears that something has happened to him. Apparently he was involved with a strange cult that may have something to do with the zombie infestation. The group has an estate in the northwest of the Beggar's Nest.
The body of a young man was found beneath the cultist estate in the Beggar's Nest. A ring on his finger identified him as Torin, brother of Jemanie.

The body of Jemanie's brother Torin was found beneath the cultist estate in the Beggar's Nest. He apparently outlived whatever use the cult and its new master had for him. There was a ring on the corpse that Jemanie would probably like to have returned.
Jemanie has been told of his brother's death. He was understandably upset and would not be consoled.
Beggar's Nest: A Strange Cult

Jemanie does not know what has caused the zombie infestation in the Beggar's Nest, but he is suspicious of a group inhabiting an estate in the northwest of the district. He says that the zombies seem to avoid the building, and do not harm the people that come and go. Jemanie may just be worried for his brother Torin, who may be involved with them, and has recently gone missing. Torim apparently let it slip that some strange creature had come to power in the group, and shortly thereafter, the infestation began.

Jemanie does not know what has caused the zombie infestation in the Beggar's Nest, but he is suspicious of a group inhabiting an estate in the northwest of the district. He says that the zombies seem to avoid the building, and do not harm the people that come and go. Jemanie may just be worried for his brother Torin, who may be involved with them, and has recently gone missing. Torim apparently let it slip that some strange creature had come to power in the group, and shortly thereafter, the infestation began. Jemanie has given out a key that his brother may have used to enter the estate.

The estate in the northwest of the Beggar's Nest is home to a snake cult, worshippers of some reptilian creature. It is not clear yet what they might have to do with the undead infestation, and they do not seem willing to offer explanations. They attack intruders on sight. The creature's name is Gulnan, but where it found the power to infiltrate the group is unknown.

The estate in the northwest of the Beggar's Nest houses a cult of snake worshippers. They used to follow Cyric, but a Yuan-Ti called Gulnan converted them by force. She deposed their old leader, and she has been killing any members of the cult that do not accept her as ruler.

The estate in the northwest of the Beggar's Nest houses a cult of snake worshippers. They used to follow Cyric, but a Yuan-Ti called Gulnan converted them by force. She deposed their old leader, and she has been killing any members of the cult that do not accept her as ruler. She has created the infestation of undead using a necromantic focus that the former leader Jared created, but nobody seems to know how she got powerful enough to use it or defeat him.

The estate of the snake cult has been thoroughly explored, leading to the discovery of a lair beneath. Likely it is from there, in the Warrens of the Damned, that Gulnan is creating and guiding her army of undead. The infestation she has unleashed on the Beggar's Nest must be stopped.
The Wailing and the Waterdhavians

As the Wailing Death spread across Neverwinter, it was soon apparent that it was not a natural affliction. It couldn't be cured by normal means, and the holiest of clerics found their divine healing useless. To fortify the city and aid in investigating the plague, Lady Aribeth de Tylmarande called for all adventurers of promise to attend the Neverwinter Academy, and also sought help from some of the greatest wizards in the Realms, including the great archmage of Waterdeep, Khelben "Blackstaff" Arunsun.
Arunsun sent a collection of magical creatures to the city, with instructions on how they might be used as reagents in a potential cure. The beasts were stored at the Academy, and with the most promising recruits graduating, the site became too tempting a target for Neverwinter's unseen enemy. In the ensuing attack, all but a handful of students were killed, and the Waterdhavian creatures fled into the night.
With the viciousness of the still unknown enemy proven, Lady Aribeth called for the survivors to do what they could to find the Waterdhavian creatures, and gather any information on the suspicious origins of the plague. Lady Aribeth hopes that her new recruits will return the beasts to her at the Hall of Justice, where she waits with her lover, Abbot Fenthick Moss, and her peer, Watchknight of Helm, Desther Indelayne.
1. Find the four Waterdhavian creatures and bring them back to Aribeth in any condition - dead or alive. 2. Seek clues about what has caused the plague. 3. Aribeth suggested that the investigation begin in the Peninsula district. 4. A Henchman would be helpful. Most of them are in the building called the 'Trade of Blades' in the City Core. 5. Healing potions are invaluable. They can be found in any store.

Significant strides have been made in the fight against the Wailing Death and those behind it. One of the Waterdhavian creatures - sent by Khelben Arunsun and lost in the attack on the Neverwinter Academy - has been recovered, and has been delivered to Lady Aribeth in the Hall of Justice. She awaits the return of the remaining three beasts in the company of her lover, Abbot Fenthick Moss, and her peer, Watchknight of Helm, Desther Indelayne. Once all have been found, the ritual to create the cure can commence.
1. Find the three remaining Waterdhavian creatures and bring them back to Aribeth in any condition - dead or alive. 2. Seek clues about what has caused the plague. 3. A Henchman would be helpful. Most of them are in the building called the 'Trade of Blades' in the City Core. 4. Healing potions are invaluable. They can be found in any store.

Significant strides have been made in the fight against the Wailing Death and those behind it. Two of the Waterdhavian creatures - sent by Khelben Arunsun and lost in the attack on the Neverwinter Academy - have been recovered, and have been delivered to Lady Aribeth in the Hall of Justice. She awaits the return of the remaining two beasts in the company of her lover, Abbot Fenthick Moss, and her peer, Watchknight of Helm, Desther Indelayne. Once all have been found, the ritual to create the cure can commence.
1. Find the two remaining Waterdhavian creatures and bring them back to Aribeth in any condition - dead or alive. 2. Seek clues about what has caused the plague. 3. A Henchman would be helpful. Most of them are in the building called the 'Trade of Blades' in the City Core. 4. Healing potions are invaluable. They can be found in any store.

Significant strides have been made in the fight against the Wailing Death and those behind it. Now three of the Waterdhavian creatures - sent by Khelben Arunsun and lost in the attack on the Neverwinter Academy - have been recovered, and have been delivered to Lady Aribeth in the Hall of Justice. She awaits the return of the single remaining beast in the company of her lover, Abbot Fenthick Moss, and her peer, Watchknight of Helm, Desther Indelayne. Once all have been found, the ritual to create the cure can commence.
1. Find the one remaining Waterdhavian creature and bring it back to Aribeth in any condition - dead or alive. 2. Seek clues about what has caused the plague. 3. A Henchman would be helpful. Most of them are in the building called the 'Trade of Blades' in the City Core. 4. Healing potions are invaluable. They can be found in any store.

There has been great progress in the fight against the Wailing Death and those behind it. All of the Waterdhavian creatures - sent by Khelben Arunsun and lost in the attack on the Neverwinter Academy - have been recovered and delivered to Lady Aribeth in the Hall of Justice.
Now that everything is in place, Lady Aribeth awaits her recruits at the Hall of Justice. She will take them to the ritual as soon as they are ready, where they can witness the creation of the cure.
1. Return to Lady Aribeth at the Hall of Justice to be taken to the location of the ritual. It will not be possible to return to the city after this.
The Great Tree: Animal Rescue

Nyatar, a druid beneath the great tree in the City Core, claims that animals in a Blacklake District zoo are being ill-treated and require rescue. Nyatar has provided a Teleport Via Plants scroll which is to be used on one of the trees near the zoo. Once broken from their confinement, any animals that are led to the tree will use it to teleport to safety at Nyatar's side.
Nyatar is pleased. All of the captive animals have been rescued from the zoo and now benefit from his druidic protection.
Blacklake: The Gauntlet Arena

There are rumors of a private warrior's club called the Gauntlet operating beneath the Board Laid Bare Inn in the Blacklake District. A pass has been obtained from a man named Graxx. Apparently anyone carrying the pass can obtain a key to the club from the bartender. It sounds like the kind of place where strong warriors could probably make a name for themselves.

There are rumors of a private warrior's club called the Gauntlet operating beneath the Board Laid Bare Inn in the Blacklake District. The key obtained from the bartender grants access to the basement. It's the kind of place where strong warriors could probably make a name for themselves.
I've been awarded the 1st Round Medal at the Gauntlet warrior's club, beneath the Blacklake District's Board Laid Bare Inn. It's not much, but I'm just getting started...
I've been awarded the 2nd Round Medal at the Gauntlet warrior's club, beneath the Blacklake District's Board Laid Bare Inn. There'll be more where that came from, that's for sure...
I've been awarded the 3rd Round Medal at the Gauntlet warrior's club, beneath the Blacklake District's Board Laid Bare Inn. I'm almost at the top... now I have to take on the owner of the place.

The Boar Laid Bare is under new managment now. Claudus lost it when he was beaten in the Gauntlet. Unfortunately, he was the driving force behind the club, and all the gladiators have left with him. There should be some profit in owning the place, however.
The Blacklake District's Board Laid Bare Inn has fallen under new management. Until further notice, the Gauntlet battle arena held in its basement has been suspended.
Moonstone Mask: Art Theft

Ophala Cheldarstorn of the Moonstone Mask has requested the theft of a series of art objects from people who have been critical of her establishment. One of them, a valuable urn possessed by a man named Hodge, is somewhere in the Blacklake District. Another, a portrait of the late Sir Reginald Rumbottom III, is said to be hidden in the Rumbottom estate in the Blacklake as well. The third is a statuette of the female form, reputed to be in the Docks District estate of a certain Androd Golden. Should any of these be 'acquired,' Ophala will pay handsomely for them.

Ophala Cheldarstorn of the Moonstone Mask has requested the theft of a series of art objects from people who have been critical of her establishment. One of them, a valuable urn possessed by a man named Hodge, is somewhere in the Blacklake District. Another, a portrait of the late Sir Reginald Rumbottom III, is said to be hidden in the Rumbottom estate in the Blacklake as well. The third is a statuette of the female form, reputed to be in the Docks District estate of a certain Androd Golden. One of these has already been returned to her but, should either of the other two be 'acquired,' Ophala will pay handsomely for them.

Ophala Cheldarstorn of the Moonstone Mask has requested the theft of a series of art objects from people who have been critical of her establishment. One of them, a valuable urn possessed by a man named Hodge, is somewhere in the Blacklake District. Another, a portrait of the late Sir Reginald Rumbottom III, is said to be hidden in the Rumbottom estate in the Blacklake as well. The third is a statuette of the female form, reputed to be in the Docks District estate of a certain Androd Golden. Two of these have already been returned to her, but should the final one be 'acquired,' Ophala will pay handsomely for it.

Ophala Cheldarstorn of the Moonstone Mask is very pleased. She had requested the theft of a series of art objects from people who have been critical of her establishment and all of those hits have been carried out with great success.
Cloaktower: Membership

I have applied for membership into the local guild of magic, the Many-Starred Cloak. In the Cloaktower, their glistening guild hall in the City Core, the guild leader, Eltoora Sarptyl, bestowed upon me a key to the guild's various laboratories throughout the city. Each is marked with a sundial and from them I am to retrieve four items: a bit of clay, a flask of water, a puff of fog, and a bit of kindling wood. She said to mark well the order, whatever that may mean. She also warned to expect dangers along my path, as the four items do not go unguarded.
Once I have obtained all four items, I am to present myself to Eltoora for whatever other tests she may deem necessary.

I have applied for membership into the local guild of magic, the Many-Starred Cloak. In the Cloaktower, their glistening guild hall in the City Core, the guild leader, Eltoora Sarptyl, took from me four items: a bit of clay, a flask of water, a puff of fog, and a bit of kindling wood.
